Job DescriptionDallas Market Center is seeking a creative, adaptable, energetic and detail-oriented Social Media Coordinator/Manager to join our dynamic, collaborative Marketing team. This role will oversee and execute multichannel social media marketing initiatives across all industries (Apparel, Home, Design, Gift, Lighting and more) to promote the Dallas Market Center brand across wholesale industry verticals, as well as support prospecting efforts. This is a work in the office position.Position DescriptionDaily responsibilities will include sourcing, developing and managing content for DMC social media channels to support both brand marketing and direct marketing initiatives. Manage DMC social media channels based on strategic objectives (including response management, content scheduling, reporting, etc.). Own and execute social content and story posting during all markets (could include weekend work as requested). Manage and monitor campaign performance on an ongoing basis by analyzing key metrics, competitive set and creating comprehensive reports. Coordinate tactical social media marketing projects, including copy and asset selection, testing, and analysis. Work with marketing team members and external partners to adjust the social content strategy & schedule to meet changing market and competitive conditions as needed. Collaborate on strategic efforts to grow social following across all DMC industries. Assist with management & organization of media asset library along with lead photography and video coordination for each major market, including budgets. Work proactively with marketing department on content creation and the creative team for creative asset requests as needed and assist with proofing copy for marketing materials, ensuring consistent voice & accurate content. Assist with media asset trafficking, reporting and content creation. Collaborate with interdepartmental team members on media partnerships/sponsorships and related events, to assist with event and marketing support, and cross promotion opportunities across industries and/or verticals. Other duties as assigned by management. Required Experience2-3 years’ experience in a marketing role (full-time or internships). Experience with social media marketing. Must have strong organizational skills, as well as attention to detail. Excellent written and verbal communication skills, as well as outstanding proofreading skills. Firm grasp on various marketing channels and best practices, including social, digital, and email. Must be a self-starter and able to independently move projects forward, prioritize tasks, and meet deadlines. Must have a high level of creativity and a passionate attitude. Must have strong analytical skills to analyze metrics and create reports. Knowledge of Sprout Social (or related), CMS administration, Google Analytics is preferred. Required EducationBachelor’s Degree in Marketing, Communications or related fieldPhysical RequirementsMust be able to sit in an office environment for the majority of each day. Evenings and weekend work could be possible at times during markets. Job DescriptionJob Title: Corporate Counsel – ContractsCompany: Aisin Holdings of AmericaDepartment: AHA Legal Affairs DepartmentLocation: Northville, MI or Seymour, INScopeAisin Holdings of America, Inc. (AHA or “Company”) is looking for a Corporate Counsel – Contracts (“Contracts Counsel”) with hands-on prior experience with contract review, transactional support, and management of contract document review workflows to assist the legal department with the contract workload. The Contracts Counsel will provide legal advice, support, and counsel relating to contract documents and transactions for the Company. This role will also assist the Company with overseeing and managing its contract document review program and contract lifecycle management program.The Contracts Counsel will review contracts and provide markups and responsive markups to contracts, draft contracts, and other contractual documents upon request. This position will also routinely participate in negotiating contracts in collaboration with company team members to ensure that the company’s legal position is protected and that it has complete knowledge of the risk involved with the contract/transaction. This position will also collaborate on outsourced contract reviews with the Company’s legal vendors and law firms.In addition to commercial and transactional support, the Contracts Counsel will oversee and manage the Company’s contract document review program. This will include oversight of workflows, including electronic intake of requests for contract review or assignment of contract reviews to legal vendors, ongoing contract negotiations, assistance with program administration, management of all open contracts, and other administrative tasks related to the contract document review program. Prior experience managing or working within a large organization’s enterprise-wide contract document review program is preferred.The Contracts Counsel will report directly to the General Counsel. The position will be based out of the Company’s Northville, Michigan, or Seymour, Indiana office. Attendance for this position will be hybrid, with 50% of the time required spent working on-site (subject to required meetings and travel). This attendance provision is a material condition for employment. This hybrid attendance may change in the future, subject to AHA policy decisions.Position ResponsibilitiesLegal:Legal review of commercial and transactional documents. Legal review of markups of commercial and transactional documents. Draft commercial and transactional documents. Maintain Company employee expectations and communicate effectively with Company employees concerning commercial and transactional document reviews and lead timesProvide advice and counsel to Company employees on legal issues relating to commercial and transactional documents, negotiations, and contract disputes. Work closely and collaborate with Company employees while negotiating contracts and transactions. Work to negotiate with customers, suppliers, vendors, and other outside parties, ensuring that the Company’s legal position is protectedManage and oversee legal vendors and law firms concerning assignment of contract reviews and legal work. Report to General Counsel on all ongoing projects and activities, including contract negotiations and the status of contract review and legal support provided for contract disputesProvide training to Company employees regarding contract best practicesCollaborate with and facilitate cross-team decision-making among the legal team, business teams, and other internal teamsAll other duties as assignedContract Document Review:Monitor and oversee the Company’s cloud-based contract queue daily. Monitor and oversee the legal department’s email address dedicated to contract issues. General review of contract documents received in queue on a timely basis. Assessment and determination of how to handle contracts. Triage and assignment of contracts to internal and external counsel for legal review. Coordinate and facilitate communication of legal reviews between internal/external counsel and team members. Maintain Company employee expectations and communicate effectively with Company employees concerning contract reviews and lead times. Issue legal approvals or denials for contracts. Consistently update cloud-based queue daily regarding the status of contracts. Supervise and manage outside counsel’s review of contracts (i.e., nonlegal issues like timing, cost, facilitation of needed information, etc..). Training team members on using the contract document review program. Any other tasks related to the Contract Document Review Program as needed. Contract Lifecycle Management:Monitor and oversee the Company’s contract lifecycle management software. Upload, tag, and organize executed contracts as needed. Work with team members to assist in uploading of all executed contracts. Work with team members to ensure the tagging and organization of all executed contracts. Work with the Company in helping to identify contract champions at each of its locations as needed. Work with Company contract champions to train and facilitate proper contract lifecycle management system usage. Upload, tag, and organize executed contracts as needed. Do you know the construction industry? Are you a natural problem solver and keen networker who thrives on building genuine, long-lasting relationships? Well look no further, this is the perfect job for you. We’re looking for someone to spearhead our business development efforts in a new region for us, North America. You will help us find clients and projects while establishing our presence in the regionYou will be one of the frontline ambassadors for our growing, world-renowned consulting team. This is both an incredibly important and highly rewarding role in which you can make a huge impact. Sound good? Well read on. (this will be a long write up but we like to give you all the details before you spend your time applying) ___________________We are Laminar Projects! We are a developer of construction software and a high-end construction project management consultancy. Improving construction strengthens the very foundation of human civilisation. (As a consultancy, we are focused on genuinely upgrading the way construction projects are delivered. We bring control and clarity to projects using a pragmatic mix of the latest technology, our own processes, and a big dose of common sense.We then take the deep understanding of the projects we work on to develop construction management software products that anyone can use to deliver their projects better. Our tech team are building a full suite of products one module at a time – kind of like office 365 but for construction management. (The core of all this is our true secret sauce; people. We only recruit the very best both in capability and personality. We are deeply focused on designing a new type of organisation that is optimised for the flourishing of the people in the team first and foremost. People that join us develop fast as a whole person in ways they never imagined. (This approach has allowed us to grow from just 2 people in 2017 to over 160 today and we are still very much at the beginning! Joining us isn’t just some “job”, it is a transformative educational experience. We challenge you to be your best self in all aspects of life.Any role that you start with at Laminar should be seen only as a starting point. Our fast growth means that there are many diverse and interesting challenges available and it is up to you to guide yourself into whichever areas you are most interested in – we will enable it.(4 core values for a good life We believe a life of human flourishing is all about meaningful relationships with others and challenging yourself to create a positive impact. So our values reflect the 4 levels of relationships that each of us has:Grow yourself – Your relationship with yourself Care about people – Your relationship with others around you Execute to greatness – Your relationship with your team Build civilisation – Your relationship with humanity and the world This goes much deeper but for the sake of brevity, we will keep the summary version!We enshrined our values in our vision: We exist so that everyone in our team can thrive in a high-impact community that: Connects us with meaningful relationships Inspires us to develop ourselves to become better humans Empowers us to pursue our own learning adventures We believe that, by first doing this, we can achieve the highest levels of value for the world. And enable the achievement of our vision through our dual missions:  To fully digitise the construction of human civilisation To create a new type of organisation that enables human flourishing while delivering a huge positive impact on society ___________________The Role Purpose of the role You will be expanding our global reach and supporting our growth through developing new business strategies, forming new relationships and ultimately winning us new projects and clients to work with in North America.Team Our Growth team is made up of our sales, marketing & video teams. Together, we tell the Laminar story to the world and make sure we are in the best possible position to continue establishing long-lasting relationships with new and existing customers. Your overall leader will be our Growth Director.Your top 3 objectives To build genuine relationships with our customers while guiding them through our buying process To develop and execute innovative new business strategies that really work To keep us two steps ahead of our competition through market insights & research Your Top 5 ResponsibilitiesOwnership of several key market segments: you’ll have full autonomy as you oversee our end to end sales process for several key market segment areas, working closely with a range of our senior leaders to drive our business development efforts Improve our processes and strategy: through providing ongoing feedback from your conversations with those in the field, development of new ideas and service offerings and consolidation of our best practice Implement new things: Keep up to date with the latest in sales & marketing systems and techniques, making recommendations on what we should be doing to stay ahead of the curve Expand your industry knowledge: Continuously develop your industry & market knowledge and help us identify target growth areas and develop our business plans Develop everyone around you: Maximise the development of your team personally and professionally and educate our wider team and clients as well through sharing knowledge Your CapabilitiesYou will be a natural effective communicator and influencer with excellent relationship building skills but also the aptitude to quickly understand complex problems through intelligent questioning and a sound understanding of the construction industry and building a b2b business.Must-Have (The fundamentals) Mastery: An excellent overall knowledge of the construction industry, regional markets and the market research skills to perform deep-dive analyses and investigations that uncover intelligence to shape our sales and expansion strategies Communication: A confident and clear communicator who can build rapport with people from all backgrounds and at all business levels Leadership: You lead yourself proactively and lead others by asking the right questions and challenging them Impact: A track record of successfully managing a b2b service-based sales process from prospecting through to onboarding Nice to Have (If you don’t have it now you will after joining) Mastery: An amazing bid writer with a high win rate when creating responses to RFP’s and tenders related to our services Communication: A true master in the art of influencing and persuasion with an extensive network in the construction and tech start-up industries Leadership: A proven leader/coach/developer of teams or teams of teams Impact: A track record of developing and executing new business strategies that have had huge business impact and improving internal processes beyond just sales Laminar isn’t the place for you if any of the following is true: You want an easy, chilled-out role without much challenge You like to be the smartest person in the room You don’t like continuously receiving honest candid feedback You prefer to do your own thing rather than work with a team ___________________Frequently Asked Questions Can you tell me more about what the role is like? You’ll work alongside many of our senior leaders in growing our business. With the support of your own dedicated researcher you will be responsible for driving all of our business development activities across a range of our key market sectors. We have big growth plans so your role is likely to evolve as we grow too.Where would I be working? Our business development roles are primarily remote and home-based however there may be times when you need to travel for the odd meeting or industry event. On average we wouldn’t expect this to be any more than once per month. If you are close to one of our offices you can come in and work from there as often as you like too. It’s also important to note that you will be working primarily independently at first as we build our presence in the region.___________________Salary And BenefitsStandard Stuff Paid Annual Leave 25 days + statutory Bank Holidays Flexible hours Pension & private health insurance IT Equipment All travel costs outside of your local area are covered The Life-Changing Stuff Grow your whole self: Our leaders are more like coaches and one of our main objectives is to give 5 years’ worth of learning and development for every 1 year with us. You have a coach, mentor, well-being therapist and a development-orientated environment: That’s literally what our vision is all about and the primary reason Laminar exists. You can check out more of Laminar's coaching program Be surrounded by the best: We only hire and retain the very best people. You might be used to being the smartest in the room but that won’t be the case in Laminar. You will be surrounded by people you can learn from. We are 100% meritocratic so fast progression is the norm. You will be supported to excel in whichever areas you are most interested in! With Laminar, development is unbounded Long-term impact: We are focused on solving the biggest issues in construction project delivery in a way that can spread and outlast us A generous equity scheme: as a fast-growing consultancy as well as the fact we are building software this has a huge upside, particularly for people that stay with us through our growth ___________________Applying properly !!!Important!!! We get thousands of applications so please write us a letter as part of your application explaining:Why do you want to join us? What do you think you bring to the team? We aren't a giant faceless corporation; we really care about the people who want to join our team so all letters will be read thoroughly.After that, we will reach out to you to schedule a casual conversation to help you to know us a bit better and tell us a bit about yourself.After that, we will schedule a couple of technical and personal assessments to understand what your level of capability is based on our own development matrix. This is to ensure that when you join you are starting at the right level of responsibility based on your capability not just based on experience.

job title: Chief Operating Officer - Pediatric Therapy Organization (01237)
full description: Job DescriptionOPEN POSITION:Chief Operating OfficerSCHEDULE: Full-Time Monday through Friday Business Hours Some Flexibility OfferedCOMPENSATION: $200,000 to $250,000 Base Salary, negotiable dependent upon experience Annual Performance Bonus (up to $40,000) Health / Dental / Vision Insurance STD / Life Insurance Paid Time Off Paid Holidays 401k Full Package NegotiableLOCATION: greater Chicago suburbs local travel requiredThis practice operates 30 clinics throughout the Chicagoland area. They’ve been operating for more than 25 years and have 30 clinic locations throughout the greater Chicago area, staffed with 700+ team members. They are an award-winning employer with a reputation for achieving life-changing outcomes in their comfortable, family-friendly clinics.POSITION DESCRIPTION:The Chief Operating Officer (COO) is a key member of the executive team, providing overall strategy and leadership in the area of clinic operations. intake and continuity operations marketingSpecific duties of the role include, but are not limited to: increase clinic engagement, performance, and profitability integrate clinical and operational departments to collaborate on shared goals oversee a KPI-based, P&L-anchored system of accountability advise CEO on staffing models, workflow improvements, and escalated operational issues increase cross-department supports by providing integrated meetings, trainings, and tools increase the standardization of operations across all clinical sites provide executive-level leadership to direct reports and peers review clinic reports across departments to identify issues for improvement strategize and develop efficiencies for intake, waitlist management, and patient continuity provide consistent training and support to Clinic Operations Managers oversee marketing to attract mission-aligned candidates and new patients in need of care develop therapist scheduling options that balance patient need and therapist preference strategize and implement tactics to increase patient attendance rates create non-siloed data transparencyThe COO will elevate the performance of operations by defining the vision, executing a supportive strategy, identifying gaps in current operations and proposing solutions,introducing innovative process solutions, and increasing systems of accountability andstandardization.REQUIREMENTS: Bachelor’s Degree in business, healthcare administration, or a related field Master’s Degree preferred 3+ years executive-level leadership experience in a relevant environment 10+ years senior-level operations experience in a relevant environment leadership experience in organizations of 300+ FTEs strong background in therapy service delivery or behavioral health preferred track record of high-level execution on corporate initiative and follow-through proven ability to give, receive, and act decisively on feedback ability to communicate effectively in difficult situations ability to be a visionary, vocal, participatory executive leader entrepreneurial spirit and desire to work in a growing environmentHOW TO APPLY:To apply for this position, please send your resume to Jenn Kunkel at jenn@chsrecruiting.com or call (773) 998-1272.Please visit www.chsrecruiting.com/jobs for a full list of available opportunities at CHS Recruiting.Company Job DescriptionBusy New York City private practice physician needs a Personal Assistant to help with both big and small daily tasks. This position would be ideal for a New York-based detailed oriented professional looking for a part-time job.The Personal Assistant work you will be asked to do may vary and could include, but is not limited, to organizing social calendar, securities research, investment research, maintenance of business equipment, organizing domestic issues like cleaning services, food delivery, business calls and faxes, receipt filing, and receipt submission, human resource functions, decorations, errand running, facilitating vehicle repairs and maintenance, filing, appointments, vacations, travel, dry cleaning, and utilizing and organizing social media and business networking services. Job Description: The Community Development Director provides management of the Community Development Department including: Zoning, Planning, Building Inspection, Contracted Engineering. This position guides the development and implementation of the City’s Master Plan, budgets and accounts for departmental expenditures, and works with the general public and staff in planning and implementing economic development projects. ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONSSupervises and evaluates all departmental staff, handling all employee concerns, directing work assignments, counseling and disciplining employees when necessary, and completing employee performance appraisals. Interprets ordinances and answers questions from staff. Establishes and administers departmental policies and procedures and annual goals for the department. Designates, supervises, and assists the division supervisors in reviewing performance appraisals and recommending disciplinary actions. Prepares the departmental budget and monitors expenditures under the current budget. Represents the Planning and Zoning Department before the Planning Commission, Mayor, City Council, and various other commissions, committees, and groups concerned with planning processes and issues. Signs and reviews purchase requests, payroll, and all written documents leaving the office. Creates, prepares, or requisitions graphic and narrative reports on land use data, including land area maps overlaid with geographic variables such as population density. Serves as liaison between the department and the public, elected officials, and other City of Tybee Island departments regarding planning and zoning. Receives and processes all zoning and lot ordinance complaints by performing on-site inspections, identifying the property owner by parcel number, and notifying the owner by certified mail if the property is in violation of a zoning or lot ordinance. Issues citations and provides pictorial and other evidence to be used in court cases against property owners who do not comply by correcting zoning/lot violations within the stipulated time period. Assists the City code enforcement officers as needed coordinating issuance of citations and monitoring for compliance with City ordinances and permits. Answers the public’s questions regarding planning. Writes reports and studies and types memos and reports when necessary. Makes zoning presentations, reviews site plans, and reads and interprets maps. Serves as liaison between the City of Tybee Island and the Georgia Department of Transportation on project-specific issues. Prepares applications for, and monitors administration of, federal and state grants. Prepares grant reimbursement requests and provides financial planning assistance related to grant administration. Prepares technical reports, studies, plans, surveys, inventories, performance audits, and analysis. Prepares and makes presentations to elected officials and the general public. Attends and reports upon meetings with the Georgia Department of Transportation, various City of Tybee Island committees, and other public agencies or community groups. Manages, develops, promotes, coordinates, and implements community-based economic development projects and activities. Prepares correspondence, reports, forms, flowcharts, graphs, spreadsheets, project schedules, and other documentation. Reviews, processes, responds, forwards, and maintains various documentation as appropriate. Responds to requests for information from government officials, City of Tybee Island employees, the general public, and other individuals. Prepares ADA Plan updates as required. Develops and maintains various databases of information needed to support ongoing or project-specific analysis. Prepares zoning verification correspondence and answers public inquiries regarding zoning and subdivision issues as assigned. Administers the City of Tybee Island’s zoning ordinance and other development-related regulations and conducts research on various issues related to zoning or development regulations as assigned. Provides instruction and direction to the general public and department visitors and receives, responds to, or forwards departmental, governmental, or public correspondence by phone, mail, message, etc. Reviews and processes Manufactured Home Permits, Home Occupation Permits, and Building Permits as assigned. Attends various training workshops, conferences, and committee and public meetings which may require meeting at night or overnight travel and records minutes of meetings as assigned. Acts as the Floodplain Manager and reviews all plans for flood regulation and zoning code adherence. Assists with Planning TransportationAssists with Planning Department/Historical PreservationPerforms other related duties as assigned. Development Review:Reviews site plans and prepares comments for the Development Review Process. Explains zoning, sign, historic preservation, and development regulation requirements for developments and land use to applicants, government officials, and the general public. Provides information to planning staff, other City of Tybee Island departments, elected and appointed officials, applicants, and the general public regarding plan review, site conditions, zoning applications, and other applicable planning information. Reviews and prepares reports on variances, subdivisions, appeals of interpretation of design review, and planned development concepts for the development review process. Assists in the preparation of zoning text amendments for review by the Planning Commission and Mayor and Commission. Monitors the submittal of Plan Review comments from other reviewing departments. Maintains database of applicant and application information. Administers the Community Tree Ordinance as it relates to development. Reviews tree canopy cover plans for compliance with tree regulations for the weekly site plans and preliminary plat review process. Develops and conducts educational programs for and provides written materials to Tybee staff, developers, builders, contractors, and other members of the development community both in the office and in the field to promote compliance with tree regulations. Performs design and analytical work on urban developments in neighborhoods and redevelopment sites/areas. Performs technical research and investigation needed for the preparation of plans, reports, and programs. Prepares and administers grants for various urban design projects or undertaken by the City of Tybee Island. Prepares design related studies and reports at the request of the City Manager, assists with the preparation of the annual budget, assists with special projects within the Planning Department, and may serve as a technical resource for other departments of the City of Tybee Island. Long Range Planning:Processes Type I and Type II applications (rezoning’s, special use permits, planned developments, conservation subdivisions, text amendments), prepares reports on Type I and Type II applications, and presents Staff Report and recommendation to the Planning Commission. Assists in the preparation and maintenance of the Comprehensive Plan and in yearly updates of population estimates and employment data at the City -wide, census tract, and block group levels. Prepares special area studies and presents recommendations regarding the communities land use, economic base, housing stock, basic infrastructure, and public utilities. Reviews and processes environmental area permits and works with developers and property owners to interpret, apply, and enforce the Environmental Areas Ordinance. Prepares special reports on topics such as the spatial location of new development and the amount of acreage of vacant land undergoing urbanization (by land use), and Parks and Open Space planning and redistricting. Responds to requests for information on demographic data including census information and acts as the Department's primary liaison with the Census Bureau. Prepares and presents presentations to the public, the Mayor and Council, Planning Commission, and other organizations and groups, effectively communicating in potentially unstable environments/situations. Rural/Urban Planning:Reviews site plans and prepares comments for the Development Review Process when applicable. Explains zoning, sign, historic preservation, and development regulation requirements for developments and land use to applicants, government officials, and the general public. Reviews and prepares reports on variances, certificates of appropriateness, land development plans, and planned development concepts. Develops and conducts educational programs for and provide written materials to City of Tybee Island staff, developers, builders, contractors, and other members of the development community both in the office and in the field to promote appropriate urban design. Performs design and analytical work on urban developments in neighborhoods and redevelopment sites/areas. Performs technical research and investigation needed for the preparation of plans, reports, and programs. Prepares special reports on topics such as the spatial location of new development and the amount of acreage of vacant land undergoing urbanization (by land use), and parks and open space planning and redistricting. Floodplain management:Review all plans for compliance with City and FEMA flood rulesCoordinate Community Rating Service requirements and submit yearly reportsAssist residents with questions regarding the floodplain and flood safety. Conduct damage assessment after major storm events. Park and Beach Planning:Assists in the execution of park and beach planning and design functions within the Department, including park master plans, park site design plans, landscape plans, park standards development and implementation, and related functions. Assembles cost estimates, documents, presentations, mapping, graphics, sketches, and construction documents, as directed. Performs Geographic Information Systems (GIS) analysis and mapping duties as assigned and maintains department GIS database. Assists with field inspections of projects for conformance to approved plans. Guides the development of various park and beach planning documents for the department including park master plans, site plans, construction documents, and design standards. Serves as department liaison for community groups, government agencies, and design consultants. Manages public input processes for planning and design projects and maintains department design, sign, amenity, and architectural standards. Generates RFPs and RFQs for park and beach planning projects, construction packages, and other development documents as needed. Develops work plans, sets project priority, tracks ongoing projects, and sets short- and long-term goals for the for park planning. Zoning and Subdivision:Performs comprehensive review of all civil and construction drawings submitted for buildings permits, prepares a written recommendation for each submittal outlining any areas of non-compliance or general concern, conducts meetings with developers/appropriate representatives to review recommendations and discuss development projects, provides written approval of zoning compliance for all development plans prior to the issuance of building and land disturbance permits, performs on-site inspections of development projects for zoning compliance, and maintains plan review files and records. Coordinates the monthly Planning Commission meeting, presents staff recommendations at the monthly public meetings, and answers any questions asked by Planning Commission. Sets the monthly agenda, assigns requests to appropriate staff members for review, prepares staff recommendations, and prepares minutes. Reviews and prepares zoning recommendations in conjunction with the general public, various planners, and other City of Tybee Island employees, prepares reports and minutes for presentation to the Planning Commission, and delivers public presentations at monthly Planning Commission meetings. Administers the City of Tybee Island’s zoning ordinance and subdivision regulations, assists in drafting amendments to the zoning ordinance, and conducts research on various issues related to zoning. Coordinates the review of subdivision plans and administration of subdivision regulations with developers, engineers, planning staff, other City of Tybee Island employees and the general public and prepares reports for presentation to the Planning Commission and Subdivision Review Committee meetings. Explains zoning, sign, and historic preservation requirements for permitting, compliance, development, and land use to applicants, the general public, and elected and appointed government officials. Reviews site plans for multi-family and non-residential developments for compliance with the zoning ordinance and other related ordinances and regulations. Prepares zoning verification correspondence and answers public inquiries regarding zoning and subdivision issues. Performs inspections of new construction and altered sites for compliance with zoning, sign, and historic preservation ordinance requirements. Assists public in filing sign permits, reviews sign permit applications, and enforces on and off-site sign ordinances. Answers general zoning and planning questions for walk-in traffic and telephone calls from the general public regarding planning, zoning, sign, or historic preservation issues. Assists in the preparation of zoning text amendments for review by the Planning Commission and Mayor and City Council. Review and approve Manufactured Home Permits, Home Occupation Permits, and Address Assignments. Assists in preparing plan review comments and meets with applicants regarding plan review items. Assists in the review of requests and applications to the Historic Preservation Commission for construction. QUALIFICATIONS Education and Experience: Requires a Bachelor’s Degree in Urban/Regional Planning, Engineering, Architecture, Landsc

This role will allow 100% remote but they are required to reside in Atlanta, GA and have ability come into the office for an occasional meeting.Looking for a Recruiter with either a Finance/Accounting OR Technical Recruiting background. Acquire industry knowledge and competitive market data and use this information to drive potential changes to the staffing plan.Perform full lifecycle recruiting to include sourcing strategy development with a clear focus on diversity. The successful Senior Recruiter will also assist with the determination of screening criteria and execution of screening, interviewing, and the negotiation of salaries.Maintain communication with all related business partners in order to perform all related Talent Acquisition functions. Work through any communication gaps to ensure staffing effectiveness and efficiency.Required Skills and Background.Bachelors degree4+ years of recruiting Professional level resources – IT, Finance, Supply Chain, MarketingFull lifecycle experience – stakeholder management, sourcing, candidate presentation, process managementExcellent interpersonal, collaboration and communication skillsFamiliar with ATS/HCM systemsDefine recruiting strategy and fulfillment planningProven history of finding and filling very specific niche professional skills

Job DescriptionIf you have a passion for supply chain, freight and transportation and you know how to keep things moving and operations running smoothly, we are looking for you!As the General Manager, you are responsible for the efficient operation of the warehouse, including order fulfillment, shipping/receiving and inventory control activities. Sales experience in maintaining and developing relationships with existing customers as well as the desire to participate with the sales department to grow new business is integral to this role. In this position, you have a starring role in helping us continue to provide outstanding solutions for our nationwide customers.At Diligent, we are constantly looking for talented individuals at all levels who can deliver the caliber of service our company requires. On our team, you’ll have the support to excel at work and the resources to build a career you can be proud of. We pride ourselves on a positive work environment that creates happy employees who boost productivity and dedication.We are seeking an experienced General Manager for our Abilene location who has successfully managed a large warehouse freight and distribution operation. Our ideal candidate brings a proven record of success in Operations and Sales with the desire to join a dynamic, growing organization.JOB REQUIREMENTS: Customer account management Prospecting, Presentations, Negotiating & closing new business Manage driver routes and handle all driver issues within the region Work in conjunction with corporate accounting staff regarding customer invoicing, vendor payments and COG efficiencies Plan and oversee implementation of policies, procedures, and programs for all areas of operations.  Maintain weekly reports for region and submit to corporate office Billing Spreadsheet Owner Operator, Independent Contractors Payables Address/Solve Customer Issues Address/Solve Owner Operator Issues Daily Review of Owner Operator Route Paperwork to include, ensure every delivery has a signature, CODs are collected, and Collection Notices are completed.  Owner Operator Engagement Routine Office MaintenanceSALES REQUIREMENTS: Maintain and develop relationships with existing customers Up-Sell additional services including Freight Forwarding to current clients Get referrals from current clients for potential opportunities Develop a database of qualified leads through prospecting decision makers through telemarketing, cold calls, face to face meetings, networking and referrals Gain a clear understanding of customers business and service requirements for operations to support customer and meet expectations Make accurate, rapid cost calculations, and providing prospects with proposals for service Produce agreements including fuel surcharges and insurance requirements Negotiate pricing and service aspects, closing new business Follow up with each A prospect within 24-48 hours of initial contact Follow up on new sales inquiries by telephone and email.  Conduct marketing campaigns in assigned territory with the help of the Corporate Office through direct marketing, email campaigns and sales blitz Maintain accurate records of sales and prospecting activities (Sales Report) Submit report weekly to Corporate Office All other duties as directed by Executive Corporate StaffEXPERIENCE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES:Associate degree or bachelor’s Degree preferred Effective Communication skills, both written and verbal Ability to build rapport, ask questions and listen Ability to negotiate and excellent closing skills Aggressive “hunter mentality”, excellent prospecting skills and strong sales ability Strong customer service skills Problem solving and multi-tasking abilities Team oriented Self-motivated, energetic, charismatic, and able to think on your feet Computer skills in Microsoft Office including Excel and Word Microsoft Streets and Trips or equivalent mapping/routing software is required 5 years of general manager experience in a supply chain, warehousing, or distribution environment 5 years of freight forwarding distribution and warehouse experience Knowledge of and experience with computerized scanning equipment Availability to work a flexible schedule, including planned and unplanned overtime, which may include weekends Working knowledge of financial accounting including developing and/or managing a P&L Experience with HR practicesABOUT US:DILIGENT DELIVERY SYSTEMS is an established yet fast growing freight forwarding, transportation, and logistics provider with locations and partners throughout the country to better serve our clients.Founded in 1995, Diligent has been providing local and regional delivery services to several niche industries. We are expanding our services to enable our customers to use Diligent as a complete transportation provider. These services include: Fulltime local and regional dedicated driver leasing positions Over the Road, LTL, FTL shipments Domestic and International Freight Cartage and Small Package / Pallet Network Program. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer.

This is a remote position.Junior Data Scientist - Remote Job, 1+ Year ExperienceAnnual Income: $60K - $65KA valid work permit is necessary in the US/CanadaAbout us: Patterned Learning is a platform that aims to help developers code faster and more efficiently. It offers features such as collaborative coding, real-time multiplayer editing, and the ability to build, test, and deploy directly from the browser. The platform also provides tightly integrated code generation, editing, and output capabilities.Responsibilities:Partner with engineers, product managers, and business partners to identify algorithmic problems, brainstorm possible approaches, and recommend the best path forward. Develop algorithms iteratively, building in the right level of complexity to solve the business problem at hand and support future improvements. Define success criteria for your models so that you can measure impact and changes over time. You'll be expected to communicate findings and drive continuous improvements. Collaborate with Software Engineers to implement algorithms in production that scale gracefully. Collaborate with stakeholders to prioritize projects and define requirements. Carry out analysis of data produced by our hardware systems and create insightful visualizations to share your findings. Contribute to internal libraries to help other teams with their data science needs including visualization, prediction, optimization, and inference. Requirements & Experience:Advanced proficiency with Python and libraries commonly used for data analysis, e.g., Pandas, NumPy, SciPy, and Matplotlib. Strong understanding of data modeling and statistical analysis. Knowledge of optimization and predictive modeling techniques and experience applying them to real-world problems. Skilled at translating a general question or problem into a clearly defined algorithmic solution. Ability to communicate clearly with both technical and non-technical audiences. Ability to work independently and manage multiple projects simultaneously. Nice to haves:1-year Experience with Data Bricks or PySpark 1 year Experience with product ionizing data models Why Patterned Learning LLC?Patterned Learning can provide intelligent suggestions, automate repetitive tasks, and assist developers in writing code more effectively. This can help reduce coding errors, improve productivity, and accelerate the development process.The pattern recognition is particularly relevant in the context of coding. Neural networks, especially deep learning models, are commonly employed for pattern detection and classification tasks. These models simulate human decision-making and can identify patterns in data, making them well-suited for tasks like code analysis and generation.

Inclusively is partnering with a multinational universal bank to hire a Personal Assistant to Global Head of Citizenship. **Please note: this role is NOT an internal position with Inclusively but with the partner company.**ABOUT INCLUSIVELY:Inclusively is a digital tech platform that connects candidates with disabilities, who may benefit from workplace accommodations, to inclusive employers. This includes all disabilities under the ADA, including mental health conditions (e.g. anxiety, depression, PTSD), chronic illnesses (e.g. diabetes, Long COVID), and neurodivergence (e.g. autism, ADHD). Applicants with one or more of these conditions are encouraged to apply; Inclusively does not require applicants to disclose their specific disability.Personal Assistant to Global Head of CitizenshipNew York, NYAs a Personal Assistant to Global Head of Citizenship, you will be accountable for providing administrative and organizational support the Global Head of Citizenship. You will be managing schedules and leading as a trusted point of contact, ensuring seamless coordination, efficient task management, and a professional presence for the Global Head of Citizenship. This is an opportunity to report to the Global Head of Citizenship, where discretion and integrity and adopting a flexible and ‘can-do’ attitude are a must.Salary/ Rate Minimum: $80,000Salary/ Rate Maximum: $107,000The minimum and maximum salary/rate information above include only base salary or base hourly rate. It does not include any another type of compensation or benefits that may be available.At our company, we offer a hybrid working experience that blends the positives of working alongside colleagues at our onsite locations, together with working from home. We have a structured approach where colleagues work at an onsite location on fixed, ‘anchor’, days of the week, for a minimum of two days a week or more, as set by the business area (or nearest equivalent if working part-time hours). TytoCare works with leading health plans and providers worldwide, to roll out Home Smart Clinic solutions that enable accessible, high-quality primary care from home, with no compromises. The Home Smart Clinic solutions include remote physical exams that work across primary care modalities, and can be tailored to any cohort or population. Together with Tyto Insights™ AI-powered guidance, provider integrations, and Tyto Engagement Labs™ which include member journeys and engagement frameworks, Home Smart Clinic solutions ensure more equitable access to care across the globe, and enable healthcare organizations to meet their KPIs.Co-founded by Dedi Gilad and Ofer Tzadik in 2012, TytoCare has FDA and CE clearances and partners with over 220 major health systems, health plans, and strategic partners in the U.S., Europe, Asia, Latin America, and Israel.At TytoCare, we're on a mission to transform healthcare delivery with our cutting-edge digital health solutions. We're looking for a B2C Marketing Coordinator who is passionate about B2C and e-commerce, driven by data, and excited to work in a dynamic, collaborative environment. If you're eager to contribute to a company that's making healthcare more accessible and efficient, we'd love to have you on our team.What You'll Do:Craft and launch targeted marketing campaigns using sophisticated automation tools to boost customer engagement and retention.Play a pivotal role in interdisciplinary efforts, enhancing our consumer and partner engagement strategies to deliver quantifiable results.Leverage analytics tools to gauge campaign effectiveness, utilizing data to drive strategic improvements.Stay ahead of the curve on digital marketing trends, privacy laws, and technological advancements, implementing best practices to position TytoCare as a leader in the healthtech industry.What You'll Bring:1-3 years of experience in D2C, B2C, and e-commerce marketing, with a strong focus on email marketing and marketing automation.Expertise in email service platforms (ESP) such as CleverTap or Braze, demonstrated by a history of successful customer onboarding and retention campaigns. Experience managing comprehensive multi-channel marketing initiatives (email, SMS, push notifications).Proficiency with data analysis tools (e.g., Mixpanel, Google Analytics), with the capability to turn insights into actionable strategies.Exceptional project management skills, able to efficiently prioritize tasks in a high-pace environment. Experience working closely with developers is preferred.Outstanding communication abilities, both written and verbal, with a knack for collaborating seamlessly across teams. Candidates should be comfortable working independently within a remote team based in the GMT+2 time zone.

Job DescriptionElaine Ellis Center of Health, a federally qualified healthcare center in Washington, DC is looking for an HIV Community Outreach Coordinator to provide community outreach services, HIV education and HIV testing as well as linking HIV positive individuals who are not receiving medical care to our Center’s early Intervention services.Core Job Duties:Responsible for conducting community-wide outreach events for individuals at risk for HIV.Conducts all programmatic outreach activities including street outreach, detention centers, shelters, private gatherings, health fairs, soup kitchens, clubs and other venues where at risk individuals are known to gather. Provides HIV program information to community collaborators. Link outreached persons to HIV program counseling and linkage to care services. Supports HIV Care Coordinator/ Case Manager in the coordination of services for and supports specific to People Living with HIV and AIDS (PLWH/A). Engage PLWH/A around housing status, health care issues/ needs and HIV status. Assess persons with known HIV status but unlinked to care and persons with unknown HIV status for readiness to be tested. Provides HIV rapid tests on-site and in community to meet program deliverables. Collaborate with local community based organizations. Assist Program Coordinator, Case Manager and Outreach team in establishing community linkages and designated outreach venues to expand client base. Collects data around member enrollment/ activities and contractual requirements. Complete all necessary paper work required by HRSA and enter data into appropriate data collection systemsInvolved in program evaluation activities. Actively collaborate with other departments/ units to develop mutually supportive program wide services, supports, and opportunities for HIV program members towards optimizing outreach opportunities. Participate in agency-wide outreach events. Other duties which may be assigned from time to time. Job DescriptionAmanda Blu & Co. is a fashion manufacturer in Shawnee, Kansas. We are seeking an experienced merchant and category manager, with an entrepreneurial spirit, self-starting approach, strong analytical skills, and passion for developing products to join our team. Primary functions include supporting strategy development and presentation of the product category, providing input, executing new product development, and analyzing assortment to maximize sales and profitability.Additional duties: assortment planning, product pricing, forecasting, and coordination with marketing and creative. This position will see strong collaboration between Product Development & Design, Inventory Control, Marketing, Ecommerce and Data Analytics teams to drive strategic growth for the brand.Job Description:Leads product development team to achieve the jewelry category sales and gross margin budgets through optimizing assortment, pricing, and strategy.  Conduct sales analyses and regularly keep abreast of industry trends to make recommendations for opportunities. Develop assortment plans – watch for and identify trends in jewelry categories. Continually find ways to expand upon category through product extensions or additions. Partner with Inventory Control to establish realistic forecasts and buy plans that will support demand and margin goals. Present accurate data for seasonal assortment planning updates. Present assumptions and conclusions that drive the direction of the jewelry category. Maintain data integrity of merchandising attributes from item inception through to printed catalogs, websites, and sales training. Adhere to timelines while also managing partners to meet strict deadlines for on time product launches. Build strong teamwork and communication strategies with Product Development, Marketing, Inventory Control, Ecommerce, and Catalog Production. Collaborate with marketing to execute product launch strategies. Coordinate with Executive Team to coordinate key accounts assortments and Scan Based Trading programs. New ProductOwns the creation and maintenance of product plans throughout various stages of development, ensuring accuracy of item detail. Research product offerings to aid with the initiation of new product development to ensure the product strategy remains relevant and competitive. Analyze classification, price point and sales trends to make informed decisions on new product. Pricing:Aid with execution and implementation of margin reviews and pricing structure strategies to ensure margin requirements are met. Conduct analysis and gather comparable product information to inform team of MSRP, wholesale cost and margin targets for new products. Validating set pricing based on margin requirements that include import duties, tariffs, packaging, testing, and freight. Conduct competitive market research on a regular basis.  Assortment AnalysisAid with execution and implementation of formal Planning reviews to achieve style count and productivity targets. Develop reports, presentations and trend reports that communicate a high-level view of new product introductions and current assortment for product development and assortment planning. Conduct key initiative information gathering and research as it pertains to the current assortment. Additional Responsibilities:Coordinate, manage, and maintain security of samples/stock. Prepare product category reviews, key account meeting materials as well as assist with other administrative tasks and projects as needed to respond to business needs. Respond to Key account jewelry directives and presentations in a timely manner. Attend trade shows to get direct customer feedback and their response to jewelry products. Qualifications:Bachelor's Degree4 years of category management or comparable merchant experience. Experience and proven history managing teams at a high performing level. Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Office products: Excel, Word, PowerPointExcellent organizational skills and ability to communicate plans and requirements clearly and concisely to a variety of teams. Must be able to travel overseas to our China offices and factories. Job Type: Full-time/Salaried Position:Pay: $ 90,000 per year with 15 % bonus potentialBenefits:401(k)401(k) matchingDental insuranceHealth insuranceLife insurancePaid time offVision insurance

full description: We are actively seeking an individual with impeccable attention to detail and a customer-centric approach to join our team as a Remote Hotel Reservationist. If you possess exceptional communication skills, exude warmth, and harbor a genuine passion for hospitality, we extend a warm invitation for you to become part of our team today! Comprehensive training will be provided to ensure your success.Responsibilities:Handle hotel reservations, managing inquiries, making bookings, and confirming room availability.Engage with guests via phone, email, and in-person interactions, addressing reservation inquiries, changes, and cancellations.Assist guests during check-in and check-out processes, ensuring a seamless experience and attending to special requests or concerns.Collect payment information, process reservations, and issue invoices or receipts as required.This remote position offers the flexibility to work from the comfort of your home or any location with an internet connection. We understand the importance of work-life balance, allowing you to manage your workload in alignment with your lifestyle.As a Remote Hotel Reservationist, you have the opportunity to take charge of your financial future. This isn't just a job; it's a chance to establish your own business within our framework. Determine your income potential, and we'll provide the support and resources to help you succeed, turning your passion into a rewarding career.Benefits:Remote position with flexible work arrangements.Travel perks and discounts for personal and professional travel.Free training.Familiarization (FAM) Trips.Supportive team environment.Qualifications:Excellent communication and interpersonal skills with a friendly and welcoming demeanor.Strong organizational and multitasking abilities.Attention to detail and accuracy.Ability to work independently and collaboratively as part of a team.Sound knowledge of travel destinations, attractions, and various travel products and services.Exceptional customer service and problem-solving skills.Passion for travel and a desire to help others create memorable experiences.Must be 18 years or older.Must speak/read English fluently; bilingualism is a plus!This entry-level position serves as your gateway into the vibrant world of the travel industry. Taking this first step allows you to positively impact travelers' lives while nurturing your professional growth. Explore the world, one exceptional experience at a time – begin your entrepreneurial journey today. 1099 Business OpportunityJoin our team now to unlock your freedom and embark on your Entrepreneurial Journey in the Travel Industry.This opportunity is available in the USA, Mexico, Costa Rica, Colombia, Argentina, Ecuador, Peru, Panama, United Kingdom, and Australia.Powered by JazzHRVOVPIW4PGx

Company DescriptionBlue Raven Solutions, including Triman Industries, Inc., and Crestwood Technology Group, LLC (collectively, the “Company”) is a portfolio company of AE Industrial Partners, LP (“AEI”), a private equity firm specializing in aerospace, defense & government services, space, power & utility services, and specialty industrial markets. Since August 2019, AEI in partnership with the Company’s management team and other shareholder partners, has been strategically building a unique platform of scale serving the complex military aftermarket with a broad set of capabilities that enable OEMs to increase sales, performance and productivity while allowing military customers to minimize program risks and costs.Blue Raven Solutions, headquartered in Morristown, NJ and having decades of operating experience, provides tech-enabled, scaleable supply chain management solutions to over 80 OEM partners and a growing list of military customers including the Defense Logistics Agency (DLA), US Navy, US Army and more. Operating through two divisions, CTG and Triman, the Company provides a broad range of solutions including distribution, program management, obolesence management, counterfeit avoidance, kitting and engineering services in support of mission critical components and systems across a wide variety of long-life military programs. This combination of solutions is supported by the Company’s proprietary, industry leading SEDNATM Analytics platform which drives data-informed decisions and outcomes while keeping fleets operational, ready, and safe.Blue Raven Solutions, including Triman Industries, Inc., and Crestwood Technology Group, LLC (collectively, the “Company”) is a portfolio company of AE Industrial Partners, LP (“AEI”), a private equity firm specializing in aerospace, defense & government services, space, power & utility services, and specialty industrial markets. Blue Raven Solutions, headquartered in Morristown, NJ and having decades of operating experience, provides tech-enabled, scaleable supply chain management solutions to over 80 OEM partners and a growing list of military customers including the Defense Logistics Agency (DLA), US Navy, US Army and more. Are you skilled at synthesizing complex financial data into actionable insights? Do you thrive in environments that require strategic thinking and meticulous attention to detail? Are you passionate about leveraging financial analysis to drive strategic decision-making? If you're nodding along, then we're excited to introduce a brand-new opportunity at our firm for a Senior Financial Analyst. This pivotal role will involve developing and maintaining comprehensive data libraries that span all facets of our business, providing the foundation for deep analytical assessments to guide strategic choices.Your primary responsibilities will include offering analytical support for various financial operations and contributing significantly to our planning, budgeting, and forecasting endeavors. You'll be instrumental in monitoring our financial performance and key metrics, conducting thorough financial reviews, and playing a vital role in our strategic planning efforts. We're looking for someone with a robust financial background, seasoned in budgeting and financial analysis, who is proactive and capable of autonomously discovering and delving into areas ripe for detailed exploration, beyond merely executing assigned tasks.This position isn't about traditional accounting; it's about adopting a forward-thinking stance on financial strategy and planning. It's a chance to step into a newly created role, where you'll have the freedom and responsibility to shape and evolve your position to maximize its impact on our firm. Join us and be a key player in our journey toward strategic growth and excellence.We offer a robust bonus plan and flexible hours including work-from-home and alternating Fridays off; health, dental, and vision benefits; competitive paid time off, and 401(k) with employer match. As the Senior Financial Analyst, you will...Conduct and coordinate financial processes including tracking, reporting, and analysis to drive the company’s financial performance.Perform routine financial reviews to identify trends, anomalies, and opportunities for improvement.Identify data-mining opportunities across the business, develop approaches to gather and organize pertinent information, and analyze to yield strategic recommendations. Participate in the budgeting process, providing detailed analysis to support budget proposals and monitoring adherence to approved budgets.Assist sales and marketing efforts by producing targeted data to enhance project pursuit efforts and proposal submissions.Engage in due diligence activities for mergers and acquisitions, including financial modeling and valuation.Support the CFO in succession planning efforts, ensuring financial leadership continuity and strategic alignment.Lead planning and analysis projects, utilizing advanced financial modeling to forecast future performance and advising on potential financial scenarios.Create and analyze various monthly, quarterly, and annual reports and ensure underlying financial information has been categorized appropriately. Develop forward-looking insights and recommendations to assist in strategic decision-making and long-term financial planning.Display time management skills, ensuring tasks are completed accurately and on schedule, and take initiative to seek out guidance or additional tasks, as needed.Demonstrate strong organizational skills, attention to detail, and the ability to collaborate effectively with various individuals.Perform special projects, as assigned. Senior Financial Analyst Qualifications – The Must-Haves (Required)Bachelor’s degree in accounting, finance, economics, or a related field, or equivalent.A minimum of 7 years of experience in financial planning and analysis, or a similar role.Senior Financial Analyst Qualifications – The Like-to-Haves (Not Required)A/E/C Industry experience.Familiarity with Deltek Vision.Salary range: $106,800-$132,200. We strongly encourage you to apply, even if you don't believe you meet every one of the qualifications described above. Diversity makes us better.Powered by JazzHRaFgaTYUim8
