Job DescriptionJob Title: Director of OperationsTeam: OperationsRole Description:The Director of Operations is responsible for leading and facilitating highly effective Coop Group Meetings (whether virtually or in-person) with the purpose of driving market share growth within the region. This individual will lead the group through strategic concepts and market dynamics to ensure there is alignment and adequate resource deployment & utilization within the group. Additionally, the Coop Facilitator will foster an environment that leans heavily on the “20%” to drive all members towards the $2M Model. This is a “high-visibility” role within the company that understands how to influences behavior to transition from planning & strategy to flawless execution.What You’ll Do:Conduct monthly and/or quarterly meetings either through video or in-person (a minimum of one meeting per year must be in-person)Maintain radical enthusiasm for “the floor” and adherence to the $2M Model to influence behaviorPrepare for each meeting with compelling content to gain commitment while fully understanding the needs of the “20%” to present the desired resource(s)Become fully versed in all available Coop Resources and their impact on the groupEstablish and maintain a leadership role within the group to deliver an impactful and consistent meeting experienceCreate a sense of community where group members share & learn from each otherFoster an environment of transparency & accountability to enhance group dynamicsApply critical thinking to turn complex challenges into actionable steps to meet group objectivesConduct individual coaching (as needed) with the “20%”Reinforce the concept that franchisees are “the who”What Abilities & Skills You’ll Need:Ability to build trust and rapport, and to articulate content clearly and cohesively to obtain consensus on group purposeAbility to foster collaboration and communication, leads the coordination of meetings, creates the agenda, facilitates group meetings and initiativesAbility to live capture of meeting discussions/decisions and able to summarize/share information within the company for alignment, clarity, and understandingAbility to exude confidence, assertiveness, and steadfast focus on group goal attainmentAbility to maintain a positive approach & mindset regardless of the situationAbility to “read” the audience, analyze the situation, and obtain consensusAbility to influence and engage with group members to gain “buy-in” to recommendthe appropriate company resource utilization and deploymentAbility to obtain effective “action items” from each meetingAbility to innovate, and bring forth proactive ideas for the continuous improvement of the Regional Coop ProgramWhat Qualifications Set You Apart:Willingness to travel frequently (up to 50% of the time)A Bachelors' or Masters' Degree (preferred) from an accredited schoolMinimum of 5 years' experience working with entrepreneurs & small business ownersMinimum of 7 years’ experience in Franchising (preferably in home improvement)Minimum of 5 years’ of experience with the leadership & facilitation of Regional Coop GroupsHighly organized, independent motivated leader with proven ability to multi-taskStrong skills in managing group dynamics as well as problem-solving, conflict resolution, and team buildingHigh sense of urgency, and assertiveness to provide appropriate recommendations or to redirect group journeyCompetent at making observations and recognizing when interactions, situations, or group dynamics changeExcellent communication, time-management, and decision-making skills

Job DescriptionPosition: Director of Business DevelopmentLocation: Remote Sales (Not required to be based in West Boylston, MA)INTRODUCTIONCurtis Industries, LLC, founded in 1968, is a market leader in the design and manufacture of cab enclosures for a diverse set of vehicles including; Compact Tractors, Golf Cars, and Utility Vehicles. Its customers include well known OEMs and a network of over aftermarket 6,000 dealers. The company’s headquarters and plant operations are located in a recently constructed, custom designed 160,000 square foot facility in central Massachusetts.Curtis has enjoyed consistent growth and is solidly profitable. The Company has been upgrading its engineering capabilities in order to increase the rate of new product introductions, shorten cycle times, and improve customer service. In short, the stage is set for rapid revenue growth.In order to continue to fuel the Company’s growth in revenue and profitability a decision has been made to grow the company’s business development capability.This exciting opportunity exists for a driven, passionate individual with a successful track record of growing revenue by identifying and securing new opportunities. Curtis’s investors and senior management team is committed to continued revenue growth and is ready to make the investments required to support this.The Company culture is open and direct. Curtis values integrity, ethics, continuous improvement, teamwork, courage and innovation.Position SummaryReporting to the Vice President of Sales and Marketing, this important position is responsible for developing strategies that deliver business development and sales growth from existing markets, adjacent markets, and entirely new markets throughout North America.The Director of Business development will lead the development of Curtis’s growth strategy and its tactical implementation. Specific responsibilities include: Identify and pursue new OEM opportunities (new customers and new markets) Leverage the company’s insight into the OEM marketplace to develop and market innovative, new Aftermarket products Identify strategic association partnerships, join key industry associations and maintain healthy relationships to further the company’s reach within the key vertical markets Actively participate as a member of the Company’s leadership teamExecution will focus on market, segment and account selection by industry verticals; engaging engineering, commercial leaders and C-Level executives. The selected candidate will work closely with the Senior Management Team to identify and support newly identified opportunities.Candidate Qualifications And Background The ideal candidate for the role will be an accomplished strategic sales professional who has successfully guided a component manufacturer serving the company’s markets through an aggressive growth phase.  Experience with low-middle volume OEM accounts in Curtis’s core and related markets.  Demonstrated the implementation of sales and marketing strategies and consistently met or exceeded planned objectives.  Curtis is particularly interested in candidates with relevant experience with a track record for making good decisions quickly, with imperfect data. On a personal level, the ideal candidate will be thoughtful, visionary and decisive. The successful candidate will be someone who works in a collaborative manner and is comfortable “quarterbacking” multi-function teams organized around customer needs.The ideal candidate will be “hands on” and lead by example.Desired Education, Experience & Attributes A Bachelors Degree in a relevant area of study such as Business, Marketing, Finance, Engineering or Management 15 years of sales development, impeccable oral, written & presentation skills Experience in strategic planning and decision making, as well as the tactical actions of successfully landing and growing identified business opportunities Experience making significant contributions to the successful growth of a smaller market company Experience in building effective customer relationships with senior executives Experience in leading the development of valid, client-perspective value propositions, bids, proposals and internal business case presentations Experience in contract law and demonstrated contract negotiation Experience with CRM systems Experience in creating completion plans and creating monthly reports illustrating accomplishments & opportunitiesAbility to sell solutions and related servicesSelf-Starter, ability to function independently without daily managementKnowledge of technical processes & mechanical productsSolid proficiency in Microsoft Office: Excel, Outlook, Word, & PowerPointSupervisory ResponsibilitiesNo direct reports but must be able to collaborate and influence both internal and external resources.TRAVEL 75%CompensationWe offer an attractive salary with a progressive and a very comprehensive benefits package including health, dental, life, disability and 401(k) Plan with a strong company match. We have a strong team-oriented work environment and provide a challenging and exciting environment that will allow you the opportunity to grow and succeed while making a significant contribution to the success of our Company.Bonus eligible.EOE/ADA/Drug Free Employer.Company DescriptionCurtis Industries, LLC is a Leader in quality cab enclosures and enclosures for Compact Tractors, Golf Cars, and UTV/Powersports Vehicles located in central Massachusetts.This exciting opportunity exists in a rapidly growing, vibrant manufacturing company in West Boylston, MA. Based on successfully executing on our growth strategy, Curtis Industries LLC is experiencing extraordinary growth in our business of providing cab enclosures, snow control products, and accessories for the tractor, utility vehicle, and golf car markets. We are ISO 9001:2015 certified and looking to stretch beyond the requirements of the standard to use elements of our QMS as a competitive advantage.EOE/ADA/ No phone calls please. Agencies who submit candidates will not be recognized without a signed contract.Curtis Industries, LLC is a Leader in quality cab enclosures and enclosures for Compact Tractors, Golf Cars, and UTV/Powersports Vehicles located in central Massachusetts. This exciting opportunity exists in a rapidly growing, vibrant manufacturing company in West Boylston, MA. Based on successfully executing on our growth strategy, Curtis Industries LLC is experiencing extraordinary growth in our business of providing cab enclosures, snow control products, and accessories for the tractor, utility vehicle, and golf car markets. We are ISO 9001:2015 certified and looking to stretch beyond the requirements of the standard to use elements of our QMS as a competitive advantage. EOE/ADA/ No phone calls please. Agencies who submit candidates will not be recognized without a signed contract.

- Remote Job, 1+ Year ExperienceAnnual Income: $55K - $65KA valid work permit is necessary in the US/CanadaAbout us: Patterned Learning is a platform that aims to help developers code faster and more efficiently. It offers features such as collaborative coding, real-time multiplayer editing, and the ability to build, test, and deploy directly from the browser. The platform also provides tightly integrated code generation, editing, and output capabilities.Summary:As a Junior Machine Learning Engineer, you will have the opportunity to work on exciting projects, develop your skills, and contribute to the development and implementation of machine learning solutions. This is an excellent opportunity for individuals looking to kick-start their careers in the field of machine learning and gain valuable experience in a collaborative and supportive environment.Responsibilities:Collaborate with senior engineers and data scientists to understand project requirements and develop machine learning models and algorithms. Assist in collecting, preprocessing, and analyzing data to uncover patterns and insights. Implement and optimize machine learning models, algorithms, and pipelines. Participate in model evaluation, validation, and performance tuning. Contribute to the development and improvement of existing machine learning infrastructure and frameworks. Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in machine learning and actively participate in knowledge-sharing activities within the team. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate machine learning solutions into production systems. Document technical processes, methodologies, and outcomes effectively. Qualifications:Bachelors or Masters degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Machine Learning, or a related field. Solid understanding of machine learning fundamentals, algorithms, and statistical concepts. Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, Java, or C++. Familiarity with machine learning frameworks and libraries, such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, or scikit-learn. Experience with data preprocessing, feature engineering, and model evaluation techniques. Knowledge of deep learning architectures and techniques is a plus. Familiarity with big data processing tools (e.g., Hadoop, Spark) is advantageous. Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously. Excellent communication and collaboration skills. Self-motivated with a strong desire to learn and grow in the field of machine learning. Why Patterned Learning LLC?Patterned Learning can provide intelligent suggestions, automate repetitive tasks, and assist developers in writing code more effectively. This can help reduce coding errors, improve productivity, and accelerate the development process.The pattern recognition is particularly relevant in the context of coding. Neural networks, especially deep learning models, are commonly employed for pattern detection and classification tasks. These models simulate human decision-making and can identify patterns in data, making them well-suited for tasks like code analysis and generation.

Job Title: Director, Health Brand StrategyLocations: New York, NY | Chicago, IL | Denver, NYDuration: Full Time, Permanent & OnsiteThe client is a strategic consulting agency dedicated to helping our clients find their true path forward. With creative rigor and genuine collaboration, we help uncover the truths that can inspire direction, change and transformation for our clients. We do this through our expertise in brand strategy, innovation and consumer insight (both qualitative and quantitative) which we deploy across our three business verticals of Consumer Packaged Goods (CPG), Health and Lifestyle.JOB OVERVIEWWe’re seeking a Director. Candidates open to a hybrid in-office schedule in NYC, Chicago or Denver are preferred, but will also consider strong candidates for remote opportunities (CA, MA and DC excepted). We are looking for candidates with previous healthcare experience (pharmaceutical experience preferred), where the work centered around brand strategy, commercialization and insights. There will be opportunity to work across Lifestyle and CPG, however, health will be the primary responsibility. We partner with patients, caregivers + care partners, consumers, and Healthcare Professionals to uncover deep insight, emotional and functional needs, and drivers of growth. We uncover patient and HCP journeys, reveal opportunities for innovation, and help define brand strategy and positioning. We are ambitious professionals who have a keen interest in working with very competitive healthcare clients who are leaders in the field and the flexibility – and empathy - to work across diverse disease states. We’re innovators in the realm of research and new product development, constantly developing new ways to reveal patterns, predispositions and even predictors of human behavior. This position requires you to create and execute a wide range of insight-hunting research, business planning, customer collaborations and ideation sessions. DESIRED SKILLS & EXPERIENCEWe are seeking teammates with strategic development and proven results on big brands, particularly helping to drive strategy and experience in commercialization of brands (pre-launch, launch and inline) a plus. Folks who are currently working for an agency or on client-side are welcomed to apply, as long as they have some previous consulting/service-side experience in foundational insight, brand strategy and/or innovation. Pharmaceutical brand specific experience is essential. We require hands on experience leading qualitative market research projects centered around brand strategy, unbranded/branded communication, creation of new product positioning, messaging strategy and innovation projects; this position requires a robust view and understanding of research, culture, health trends, patient or provider experience; diversity in category and Rx brands. Showing up as a team and rolling up your sleeves to do the work alongside your teammates is a must. We seek to do more challenging, bigger impact work that requires an experienced team and partnership - not just with sr. leadership but with your peers, jr. teammates and operations + project management partners.  Having a fearless growth mindset is critical to your success . This means being able to know we don’t all know everything and there is something new to learn every day, to being humble enough to learn from mistakes, support your teams and embrace a continuous improvement attitude. We are seeking people who love to immerse themselves in a strategic issue through leading sensitive and revealing conversations with patients, caregivers/care partners and HCPs – in homes, research facilities, in office and online, to learn their perspectives.  Practical experience with applied behavioral science and understanding the role cognitive bias has in decision making and how that applies to opportunities for brands is a plus. Mentoring, teaching, actively listening and proactively relaying ideas both up and down the line management chain is a must and is core to positive collaboration. Communication skills are key to fostering rewarding partnerships both internally and externally with clients. Understanding the context of one another’s behaviors and motivations is key to those partnerships. Being able to have positive and constructive conversations is a must.  Our Directors enjoy generating significant new business and being accountable for leading new clients and projects on a consistent basis. Being motivated by and able to demonstrate a track record of this business ambition is key to success in this position. You will be responsible for helping to drive both vertical and company growth through new business efforts via organic growth and new business outreach. Significant experience with pharmaceutical brands required, ideally coming out of another market research / strategy consultancy. Moderating experience required.We create highly-visual, multi-media stories to convey our insights, strategies and innovation ideas. The ability to convey your ideas through photos, videos and stories is important in this position.  Collaborative, friendly and team-oriented, we place an enormous amount of emphasis on our company culture and providing strong career mentoring to ensure personal success and job satisfaction. We are motivated by having our creative-thinking skills consistently stretched, seeing our ideas succeed in the marketplace and working to lead the world’s most famous brands towards growth. MBA or Graduate degree in a Healthcare related focus is plus but not mandatory.Thanks & Regards,Daniel S (Saiyed)Executive Recruiterdaniel.s@brightpathassociates.com

Are you an Architect who flourishes when part of a cohesive team where collaboration and ideas flow freely, professional development is prioritized, and opportunity exists at all levels? If you want to work for a firm that's taking concrete action towards equity, diversity, and inclusion in the workplace, we’re looking for Architects at all levels to join our Civic, Education, and Healthcare teams in our Oakland office. We offer a robust bonus plan; health benefits; flexible hours including work-from-home, and alternating Fridays off; competitive paid time off; and a 401(k) matching program!An ideal candidate will be able to build on their basic understanding of the phases of an architectural project, project management and construction administration, and client interactions. We are looking for an individual who wants to change the world by “designing a better future” one project at a time. Sound like you?As an Architect, you will... Develop and coordinate drawings and specifications, manage consultant coordination of projects, and take part in all phases of the design process. Coordinate with project leads to:Develop solutions for design problems, including program compliance, code compliance, and agency interface. Develop plans, address and find solutions for project-related issues, and collaborate with senior staff on projects that are more complex in nature. Identify and address issues affecting project delivery, budget, construction costs, schedule, and any risk management concerns. Prepare and adhere to project management plans by coordinating with the project team for completion of tasks consistent with project timelines and budgets. Provide technical oversight and coordination of project activities, including construction administration, with clients, consultants, contractors, and staff. Complete and keep code review and analysis through the completion of the projects. Advise project leads of potential client and consultant requested changes to scope of work; figure out cause and effect to project budget and schedule on larger project. job title: Associate Privacy Attorney (Full Time, Remote Position)
full description: About VeraSafeVeraSafe is an innovative and successful U.S. headquartered privacy and cybersecurity compliance consulting firm and law firm. Due to rapid growth and increased demand for our international privacy and technology compliance and legal services, VeraSafe is seeking creative, motivated, and collaborative attorneys to join our team, regardless of prior work experience or education background. This is a fully remote position and will remain a fully remote position. Check out our other great benefits, listed at the end of this job description.About the RoleThis is an excellent opportunity for anyone who wants to join a team working on the cutting edge of privacy and data protection, and who wants to further develop a practice in an in-demand, high-tech area of law. We are inundated with business from clients who love the way we advise on privacy compliance (hence the need for you!).We have found our strongest team members don’t necessarily have prior experience in privacy law. You’ll begin with a robust and established onboarding and training process and quickly begin attending client calls and doing substantive work.Note: There is a 1-3 hour skills assessment associated with the recruitment for this position. We know this is a burden, but we think it’s worth it, and we appreciate you taking the time to complete it. We’ve found it enables us to find the best attorneys, regardless of their experience, where they went to law school, or where they were trained. We want smart, kind, creative lawyers, plain and simple, and this assessment is a crucial part of our ability to hire this way.We are not your typical legal job. We use project managers to keep our remote team organized and our projects streamlined and on-track. We encourage our team members to travel and to make use of our ability to work as digital nomads, whether that means spending a month abroad or on extended trips to be near family. Because we’re a fully remote team, we’re also flexible about where you make your home base so long as you’re legally able to work and practice law there. We collaborate closely (you won’t feel like you’re working in isolation) and we actively encourage sharing of credit for work well done, resources, and advice (and penalize the reverse).We are not biglaw. We do top-notch work for biglaw-level clients, yet we pride ourselves on our team members being happy, with time and energy for a life outside of work, which we believe makes us better attorneys who don’t burn out and deliver higher quality work product. Our salaries are competitive with mid-sized firms in mid-sized markets, but we have lower billable requirements. Our annual bonus is spread and paid over the four quarters of the year and earned from exceeding your billed time requirements on a quarterly basis, so you can have more or less productive quarters based on the realities of your life.The bottom line: If you want to learn or go deeper practicing privacy law, if you want to practice in a problem-solving environment focused on giving excellent and yet actionable advice, if you want to work with a global team of friendly, brilliant people, if you want the flexibility to work in a way that makes sense to you, please apply!Responsibilities include:Assessing client information systems for compliance with data protection laws and regulationsDrafting data protection agreements, addenda, and amendmentsAdvising clients on privacy-related product improvementsResearching legal issues and composing legal opinions/memorandaWriting privacy law related articles and blog postsAssisting in the development of in-house legal templatesContributing to the development of internal procedures and methodologiesCollaborating with a team of intellectual peers who value cooperation and community.What We Need From YouNeed to have:License to practice law (active and in good standing) in your jurisdictionAt least three years of work experience as an attorneyAn interest in privacy and technologyTeam player, interested in contributing to a growing enterpriseStrong writing/editing skills and attention to detailAbility to work remotelyWillingness to learn new skills and receive direction and feedback from partnersWillingness to pursue privacy certifications (e.g., CIPP/E, CIPM)Nice to have:Previous contract drafting and negotiation experience strongly preferredExperience/training in privacy lawPrivacy certifications of some kind (e.g., CIPP/E, CIPP/US, specialty from law school, etc.)Professional involvement in the privacy and/or data security space (attendance at privacy conferences; membership or publication in the IAPP, etc.)Key CompetenciesDetail-oriented and highly organized with a strong work ethicTech-savvy and comfortable using a variety of software applicationsExcellent written and verbal communication skillsAbility to manage your own schedule in order to work successfully with international teams and meet deadlinesAbility to work independently and fully deliver on all commitmentsVeraSafe’s Excellent Benefits Include:Paid time offPaid holidays401kEligibility for annual bonusesReimbursement for certain personal flight ticketsFlexible working schedule in some rolesWork from almost anywhere with Wi-FiMembership in the International Association of Privacy Professionals (IAPP) and IAPP exam fee reimbursement (CIPP/E) and eligibility for bonuses for achieving professional certificationsOptional Bring Your Own Device (BYOD) programChoice of Mac or PC company laptop (if not utilizing the BYOD program)Twice-a-month paydaysDirect depositHealth Insurance, Other Insurance, HSA Benefits, etc.:Health InsuranceHealth Savings Account (HSA): Pre-taxed funds available to pay for health-related expensesDental InsuranceVision InsuranceEmployee Basic Term Life and Accidental Death and Dismemberment (AD&D) InsuranceEmployee Voluntary Term Life InsuranceSpouse Voluntary Term Life InsuranceChild(ren) Voluntary Term Life InsuranceLong Term Disability (LTD): Income As a Remote Travel Airline Customer Service Agent, you will be responsible for providing exceptional customer service to airline passengers and booking travel remotely. Your primary objective is to assist clients with various inquiries, issues, and requests related to their travel experience, ensuring a smooth and pleasant journey. Below are the key responsibilities and qualifications for this role.Responsibilities:Customer Assistance: Provide courteous and efficient assistance to airline passengers via phone, email, or online chat, addressing inquiries regarding flight reservations, ticketing, baggage, flight status, and other travel-related matters. Such as booking their hotel and car rental if needed.Booking Management: Handle flight bookings, changes, cancellations, and seat assignments accurately and promptly, adhering to airline policies and procedures.Issue Resolution: Resolve passenger issues and complaints professionally and empathetically, offering appropriate solutions and ensuring customer satisfaction.Flight Information: Provide passengers with up-to-date flight information, including delays, cancellations, gate changes, and boarding procedures, to help them navigate their travel plans smoothly.Baggage Assistance: Assist passengers with baggage-related inquiries, including lost or delayed baggage, baggage allowances, restrictions, and tracking procedures, and facilitate resolution as needed.Special Requests: Accommodate passengers' special requests, such as wheelchair assistance, dietary preferences, unaccompanied minors, and medical needs, coordinating with relevant departments and service providers as necessary.Fare Quotes and Promotions: Provide passengers with fare quotes, promotional offers, and upgrades, explaining terms and conditions and assisting with booking decisions.Documentation Assistance: Assist passengers with travel documentation requirements, visa inquiries, passport validity, and other pre-travel documentation, directing them to the appropriate resources when needed.Travel Policies: Stay informed about airline policies, procedures, regulations, and travel advisories to provide accurate and reliable information to passengers.Cross-Selling and Up-Selling: Identify opportunities to cross-sell ancillary services, such as travel insurance, lounge access, seat upgrades, and additional amenities, to enhance the passenger experience and generate revenue.Quality Assurance: Maintain high standards of service quality, professionalism, and adherence to service level agreements (SLAs) in all customer interactions.Documentation and Reporting: Document customer interactions, inquiries, resolutions, and feedback accurately in the airline's customer relationship management (CRM) system and provide regular reports to management.Qualifications:Customer Service Experience: Previous experience in customer service, preferably in the airline industry or a related field, with a strong focus on delivering exceptional service and resolving customer issues effectively.Communication Skills: Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to communicate clearly, professionally, and empathetically with passengers from diverse backgrounds.Problem-Solving Abilities: Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to analyze situations, identify solutions, and make timely decisions to meet passengers' needs and expectations.Technical Proficiency: Proficiency in using computer systems, reservation systems, airline software, and communication tools to manage bookings, access information, and assist passengers remotely.Adaptability: Ability to work effectively in a remote environment, managing multiple tasks, adapting to changing priorities, and maintaining a high level of productivity and professionalism.Team Collaboration: Collaborative attitude with the ability to work independently as well as part of a virtual team, cooperating with colleagues, supervisors, and support staff to achieve common goals.Attention to Detail: Strong attention to detail and accuracy in handling passenger information, reservations, and documentation to ensure data integrity and compliance with privacy regulations.Empathy and Patience: Empathetic and patient demeanor with the ability to remain calm, courteous, and composed when dealing with demanding or distressed passengers, resolving conflicts with diplomacy and tact.Education: A high school diploma or equivalent qualification is required; additional training or certifications in customer service, travel management, or airline operations are advantageous. Must be able to work in the U.S.Salary: Based on commission and performance Possibly. $30,000 - $65,000 yearlyPowered by JazzHRLtyvu66O4m

Job DescriptionPOSITION SUMMARY: The Payroll Specialist is a member of the People & Culture team and will contribute to the overall culture of the company. The Payroll Specialist is primarily responsible for planning, directing, and coordinating payroll activities of the company. This includes benefits administration, payroll reconciliation, payroll deductions, general ledger management, and people analytics.KEY DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:Process and issue employee paychecks and statements of earnings and deductions. Compute wages and deductions, and enter data into HRIS and relevant systemsAddress and resolve employee’s questions and concerns regarding payroll. Work with company database programs to process payroll for all Redstone team members. Prepare and submit all payroll expenses into ERP software. Prepare reports to relevant departments about payroll, including GLs, reimbursements, etc. Work closely with benefit providers to manage company benefits. Responds to benefits inquiries from managers and employees on plan provisions, benefits enrollments, status changes, and other general inquiries. Assists with the open enrollment process. Prepare and balance period-end reports, and reconcile issued payrolls to bank statements. Review time sheets, work charts, wage computations, and other information to detect and reconcile payroll discrepancies. Collect and export time cards each pay period. Issue and record adjustments for previous errors or retroactive increases. Provide information to employees and managers on payroll matters, tax issues, benefit plans, and collective agreement provisions. Compile reports, statements, and summaries related to pay and benefits accounts, and submit them to appropriate departments. Complete, verify, and process forms and documentation for administration of benefits, such as pension plans, and unemployment and medical insurance. EXPERIENCE & QUALIFICATIONS:A minimum of 3+ years of payroll processing experience is required. A bachelor’s degree in human resources, accounting, or finance is preferred. Experience administering or overseeing benefits administration and open enrollment. Experience navigating and operating an HRIS is required. Proficient or expert-level experience with Excel is required. Strong knowledge of tax and wage laws in multiple states. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Exceptional organizational skills and ability to prioritize tasks. Knowledge of economic and accounting principles and practices, the financial markets, banking, and the analysis and reporting of financial data. Self-starter with the ability to carry out necessary projects in a timely manner without supervision. BENEFITS: Health, Vision, and Dental Insurance15 days of PTO and 10 paid holidaysPaid parental leave401K Plan with up to 6% matchingContinued Education ProgramEmployee Assistance ProgramProfessional Development ProgramShort-term Disability InsuranceCompany DescriptionHelping companies find the best talent to reach their goals.Helping companies find the best talent to reach their goals.

Job Description Test Automation Proficiency: Require expertise in test automation. Demonstrating proficiency in scripting languages, automation frameworks, and the ability to create and maintain automated test suites showcases a higher level of technical skill and efficiency in testing processes.  Quality Advocacy: As a mid-level QA professional, there's an expectation to not only identify issues but also to advocate for and implement quality improvement initiatives. This involves influencing development processes, promoting best practices, and actively participating in continuous improvement efforts to enhance overall product quality.  Test Strategy Development: Involve contributing to the development of comprehensive test strategies. This includes designing test plans, defining testing scope, and implementing effective testing methodologies tailored to the specific needs of projects or products.  Leadership in Testing Activities: Leading and coordinating testing efforts. This involves managing testing teams, assigning tasks, and ensuring that testing activities align with project timelines and goals. Leadership skills become increasingly important at this career stage.  Risk Analysis and Mitigation: Iidentify potential risks in the software development process and implement strategies to mitigate them. This involves a deeper understanding of the business impact of defects and a proactive approach to preventing issues before they escalate. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree.  Basic knowledge of software QA methodologies, tools, and processes.  Experience in writing clear, concise, and comprehensive test plans and test cases is a plus.  Familiarity with bug tracking tools (e.g., JIRA).  An understanding of Agile/Scrum development principles.  Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.  Excellent communication and teamwork skills. Additional Skills (Preferred, but not required): Knowledge of automated testing tools (e.g., Selenium) is a plus.  Basic understanding of coding and scripting for testing purposes.  Experience with performance and/or security testing is beneficial. Job DescriptionProman Skilled Trades is currently seeking a dedicated Sheetmetal Mechanic to join our team. As a Sheetmetal Mechanic, you will play a crucial role in installing HVAC materials, fabricating or modifying parts, and ensuring the proper installation of ductwork and sheet metal assemblies according to blueprints and specifications. A valid driver's license is a mandatory requirement for this position.Essential Duties:The Sheetmetal mechanic will install HVAC materials: You will be responsible for the precise installation of various HVAC materials, including round pipe/spiral duct, flex duct, motorized dampers, fire dampers, air devices, louvers, and air moving equipment. The Sheetmetal mechanic will fabricate or modify parts: Utilizing a range of tools such as shears, brakes, saws, and welding equipment, you will fabricate or modify parts as necessary to meet project specifications. The Sheetmetal mechanic will install ductwork and sheet metal assemblies: Following detailed blueprints and specifications, you will install ductwork and sheet metal assemblies with precision, ensuring proper alignment and fit. The Sheet metal mechanic will fasten seams and joints: Seamlessly fasten seams and joints using bolts, cement, rivets, caulk, and clips to guarantee air-tight installations. The Sheetmetal mechanic will drill and punch holes: Skillfully drill and punch holes in metal as required, and install duct taps for efficient connections. The Sheetmetal mechanic will operate equipment: Safely operate equipment such as man lifts, personal lifts, chain hoists, and duct jacks to facilitate installations efficiently and securely. The Sheetmetal mechanic will perform related duties and special projects: Complete related duties as assigned by supervisors and actively participate in special projects to ensure timely and successful project completion. Qualifications:High school diploma or equivalent. Proven experience as a Sheetmetal Mechanic. Valid driver's license. Proficiency in reading and interpreting blueprints and specifications. Ability to effectively utilize various hand and power tools. Exceptional attention to detail and accuracy. Strong problem-solving abilities. Capacity to work both independently and collaboratively within a team environment. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.

Job DescriptionSupervises and coordinates activities of workers engaged in setting up, installing, repairing, and maintaining machinery and equipment. Oversees job performance and quality of work performed in a multi-craft environment involved in all facets of the technical field. Trains employees regarding procedures and safety. Manages the Maintenance Department by supervising daily work and schedules, as well as capital projects and Computerized Maintenance Management System. Key Responsibilities:Ensures that all department safety practices are followed. Coordinates and supports Maximo system. Supervises and coordinates activities of workers engaged in setting up, installing, repairing, and maintaining machinery and equipment. Provides leadership and direction for subordinates; analyzes and resolves work problems, initiates plans to motivate team to meet goals, enforces safety regulations, coaches and hands-on training, and promotes an overall positive environment. Oversees job performance and quality of work performed in a multi-craft environment involved in all facets of the technical field; quality checks, suggest changes to increase efficiency. Manages a vendor base to ensure quality product availability while minimizing costs and maintaining the highest of service levels to the plant. Provides technical support and training to maintenance and manufacturing personnel at other facilities. Supervises storeroom and procures plant supplies. Researches and executes capital appropriation expenditures. Manages procurement activity of repair and maintenance goods and services. Reconciles invoice discrepancies and approves for payment. Works daily to ensure assigned areas of responsibility are working with risk lowered to as low as reasonably achievable. Performs activities of subordinates and other assigned duties. Directly supervises employees in the Maintenance Department: interviewing, hiring, and training employees; planning, assigning, and directing work; appraising performance; rewarding and disciplining employees; addressing complaints and resolving problems. Qualifications:Minimum 3 years’ experience supervising maintenance employees in a manufacturing environment is required. Experience with PLCs a MUST; Siemens or Allen Bradley. Knowledge of manufacturing methods and techniques. Broad technical training (high school plus 1 to 3 years’ apprenticeship/applied trades training or 2-year Associate Degree). Steel-toe shoes/boots required. Must be able to work Mon-Fri, 7am-4pm (facility runs 24/7 and requires to work outside of those hours, when needed).

Position provides GPS and GIS support for other Parks & Trails Division projects. Position assists the Regional Manager in the operation of the Minnesota Trail Assistance Program (Grant-In-Aid). Coordinates and supports acquisition and development projects with Division staff. Responsibilities include:Program/Project Management: Coordinate and support regional land acquisition and development activities with South Region Acquisition and Development Specialist. Convene and contribute to meetings with stakeholders and governmental units. Participate on department committees, task forces, work groups, regional planning, and division teams. Develop, direct, and implement a public relations program for recreation area visitors, recreation area neighbors, local communities, and public agencies.Administration: Aid with work plans and budgets for operations and maintenance activities. Aid in the operation of the Grant-in-Aid programs. Direct work of professional and technical staff, laborers, volunteers, temporary crews; ensure safety procedures and policies are followed, assist in equipment management. Provide project development reconnaissance and monitoring, requiring the use of All-Terrain Vehicles, fleet, and equipment operations, and at times foot travel over challenging terrain. job title: Executive Assistant to the CEO and CTO
full description: At Tecton , we are on a mission to bring Machine Learning to every customer and product interaction on the planet. We build an enterprise-grade, world-class Feature Platform – the infrastructure that powers real-time ML applications and systems in production.Tecton’s founders developed the first Feature Store when they created Uber’s Michelangelo ML platform, and we’re now bringing those same capabilities to every organization in the world.Tecton is funded by Sequoia Capital, Andreessen Horowitz, and Kleiner Perkins, along with strategic investments from Snowflake and Databricks. We have a fast-growing team that’s distributed around the world, with offices in San Francisco and New York City. Our team has years of experience building and operating business-critical machine learning systems at leading tech companies like Uber, Google, Meta, Airbnb, Lyft, and Twitter.We are seeking a highly organized and proactive Executive Assistant to support our CEO, CTO, and the executive suite. This role is pivotal for the smooth operation of our fast-paced startup. The ideal candidate will excel in a dynamic environment, managing multiple priorities with a high degree of professionalism and efficiency. In addition to traditional executive support responsibilities, this role will also involve working on special projects that are critical to our company's growth and innovation.ResponsibilitiesProactively manage all aspects of CEO & CTO’s calendar across internal meetings and external engagements, proactively resolving all conflicts and optimizing weekly calendar loadsKeep well informed of CEO commitments and responsibilities, and contribute to the development and implementation of organizational processes and systems to improve efficiency.Provide comprehensive support to the CEO, CTO, and executive suite, ensuring efficient operation of the leadership team.Attend key meetings as needed, track follow-ups and deliverables; prepare and edit correspondence, communications, presentations, and other documents.Organize and plan internal and external meetings such as staff meetings, team events, department All Hands, leadership offsites, etc.Coordinate domestic and international travel within Tecton’s travel policy, and manage and reconcile expense reports.Assist in various business and People-related cross-functional projectsFlex to new responsibilities as needs arise, capabilities match, and time permitsQualifications7+ years of demonstrated success in supporting Executives.You have demonstrated ability to prioritize tasks, anticipate the needs of the CEO, and stay organized in a demanding environment.Emotional intelligence and the ability to be resourceful when obstacles arise. Having a sense of urgency, being proactive, along with strong prioritization skills, business judgment and communication skills are crucial for this role.Take ownership of projects, you have a passion for partnering with busy executives to help them reach their highest potential and you can provide tangible solutions.Skillful execution of administrative activities, with high attention to detail, organization and process.You want growth -- company growth and career development. You thrive in an environment that is fast-paced and changes as the company grows rapidly.Ability to demonstrate professionalism, discretion, and confidentiality.Proficiency with Google Suite, Zoom, Slack, and DocuSign.You can work non-standard, flexible work hours as required.You must be willing to commute to local based SF-headquarters regularly.$104,000 - $128,000 a yearThe estimated US base salary range for this position is $104,000 - $128,000 annually for employees based within California & New York. In addition to base salary, we offer competitive equity & comprehensive benefits such as medical, dental, vision, life, 401(K), flexible paid time off, 10 paid holidays each calendar year, sick time, leave of absence as per the FMLA and other relevant leave laws. Individual compensation packages are based on multiple factors such as location, level, role scope, and complexity, as well as additional job-related factors such as skills, experience, and expertise.Tecton values diversity and is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees and applicants without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. If you would like to request any accommodations from the application through to the interview, please contact us at recruitingteam@tecton.ai.This employer participates in E-Verify and will provide the federal government with your Form I-9 information to confirm that you are authorized to work in the U.S.

full description: - Remote Job, 1+ Year ExperienceAnnual Income: $60K - $65KA valid work permit is necessary in the US/CanadaAbout us: Patterned Learning is a platform that aims to help developers code faster and more efficiently. It offers features such as collaborative coding, real-time multiplayer editing, and the ability to build, test, and deploy directly from the browser. The platform also provides tightly integrated code generation, editing, and output capabilities.About The JobAs a Python Django Developer, you will be responsible for developing and maintaining our SaaS product, utilizing Django, Django Rest Framework (DRF), Celery, and MySQL. Your role will involve creating efficient and scalable RESTful services, ensuring high-quality code, and collaborating with cross-functional teams to deliver a superior user experience.Responsibilities:Develop and maintain our SaaS product using Python and Django. Utilize Celery for task scheduling and distributed message passing. Write clean, maintainable, and efficient code, adhering to best practices and coding standards. Optimize application performance, scalability, and reliability. Troubleshoot and debug issues, identifying and implementing solutions. Collaborate with other team members on code reviews and continuous improvement. Stay updated with industry trends and advancements in Django, Python, and related technologies. Qualifications:Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field (or equivalent experience). Proven experience as a Python Django Developer, preferably working on SaaS products. Strong proficiency in Python and Django framework. Familiarity with Celery for task scheduling and distributed systems. Proficiency in MySQL or other relational databases. Solid understanding of software development principles and best practices. Strong problem-solving skills and ability to troubleshoot and debug complex issues. Excellent communication and teamwork skills. Self-motivated and able to work independently, as well as in a team environment. Strong attention to detail and commitment to delivering high-quality work. Why Patterned Learning LLC?Patterned Learning can provide intelligent suggestions, automate repetitive tasks, and assist developers in writing code more effectively. This can help reduce coding errors, improve productivity, and accelerate the development process.The pattern recognition is particularly relevant in the context of coding. Neural networks, especially deep learning models, are commonly employed for pattern detection and classification tasks. These models simulate human decision-making and can identify patterns in data, making them well-suited for tasks like code analysis and generation.

About LACIThe Los Angeles Cleantech Incubator (LACI) is a private non-profit organization creating an inclusive green economy by unlocking innovation (through working with startups to accelerate the commercialization of clean technologies), transforming markets (through partnerships in transportation, energy and sustainable cities) and enhancing communities (through workforce development, pilots and other programs). Founded as an economic development initiative by the City of Los Angeles and its Department of Water & Power (LADWP), LACI is recognized as one of the most innovative business incubators in the world by UBI. Since 2011, LACI has helped 375 portfolio companies raise $1 billion in funding, generate $335 million in revenue, and create 2,626 jobs throughout the Los Angeles region, with a projected long-term economic impact of more than $585 million. Learn more at.About LACI’s Innovation PilotsLACI launched our Innovation Pilots in 2019 to help bring the benefits of the green economy to neighborhoods that often lack cleantech solutions yet are burdened with poor environmental quality, and to surface learnings that can be applied to scale the adoption of cleantech solutions throughout the LA region and beyond. LACI deploys these pilot projects with and within selected communities defined by the state as “” to address community needs as well as key technology, business model and educational challenges. Past and current pilots have tested electric vehicle car share models, e-bike lending library models, neighborhood electric vehicle shuttle services, and the deployment of induction stoves in low-income single-family homes.Position Summary:Reporting to the Vice President of Innovation Pilots, the Manager, Innovation Pilots plays a key role in LACI’s work to develop and execute catalytic pilots in underserved communities with startups and partner organizations. This role works to drive utilization of the innovation pilots in partnership with community based organizations, business entities, and elected officials, ensuring that we collect data and assess the impacts of the pilots in order to both pivot as needed and to surface lessons that can be utilized to scale the adoption of technologies deployed. The Manager, Innovation Pilots works as part of the Innovation Pilots Team to tackle pilot strategy and execution, working to advance the overall priorities set forth by the Market Transformation team with direction from the cross departmental Pilots Coordinating Team (PCT) and in consultation with LACI’s Clean Energy, Transportation Electrification, and Sustainable Cities partnerships.What You’ll Do:Pilot Concept Development: Contribute to the cross-team development of innovative pilot concepts, offering effective customer outreach strategies to drive adoption and increase utilization. Collaborate with LACI’s leadership to establish pilot impact goals and success metrics. Work with the VP Innovation Pilots to draft the customer acquisition strategy, community outreach, and utilization components of the pilot implementation plans and budgetsFundraising and Grant Proposals: Assist the VP, Innovation Pilots and the Development Team with grant proposal development and grant administration once awarded, as needed. Participate in the discovery/research phase to determine need/demand for potential future pilotsPre-Pilot Preparation: Organize internal LACI pilot kick-off meetings as needed. Identify possible community outreach and implementation partners for pilots and provide selection recommendations to the Pilots Coordinating Team. Draft community partner contracts and shepherd through signing process. Support Pilots Team in the selection process for technology partners. Convene meetings with community partners, draft agenda items, and lead resulting discussions to shape pilot preparation to maximize utilization. Draft Customer Acquisition and Utilization Plan for each pilot, including related KPIs and tactics (eg. focus groups, information sessions, tabling) and tools for tracking progress (eg. surveys, enrollment forms, reports, etc.)Pilot Implementation: Facilitate conversations between community partners and tech providers to ensure smooth deployment and utilization of new technology solutions in the community. Collect and assess pilot utilization data to track progress. Work with community partners to adjust the customer acquisition and utilization strategy, during the pilot as needed. Pilot Communication and Adoption: Collaborate with the Marketing and Communications team to implement communication strategies (including logos, flyers, direct mailers, blogs, social media posts, and press releases). Collaborate with the Government Affairs team to boost outreach through the support of local elected officials. Organize and coordinate LACI-led community events and workshops to drive customer adoption and pilot utilization. Organize meetings with community partners and hold regular meetings to support them in achieving customer acquisition and pilot utilization KPIs. Manage invoices from community partner subcontractors and support the VP of Innovation Pilots with tracking spend on outreach, customer acquisition, and pilot utilization effortsPost Pilot Wrap Up: Manage invoices from subcontractors and support the VP of Innovation Pilots with tracking spend on outreach, customer acquisition, and pilot utilization efforts. Help organize final press events/materials. Document key learnings as it relates to outreach, customer acquisition, and utilization to inform best practices for similar innovation pilots in the future. Why You’re Right for the Job:You’re ambitious and driven. This comes primarily from your desire to create meaningful change through your work. Due to this inner drive, you have a tendency to take projects further, faster, and you’re willing to go above and beyond to get the job done well. You believe clean technologies are the future. You have an interest in making the world a cleaner, safer and better place to live in through clean technologies. You enjoy bringing people together. You foster inclusion because you understand the technical needs and community barriers to adopting cleantech in the communities we serve. You’re a team player. You thrive in a highly collaborative work environment working with different team members and departments to meet LACI’s external goalsYou thrive working on new projects. You enjoy building and supporting a new project that hasn’t been done before. You are comfortable navigating ambiguity and believe that the final decision is in the best interest of LACI. Requirements:Basically, we want to know you can get the job done. This means you have:BA/BS degree in relevant field Project Management: 3-5 years related project management work experience, preferably in cleantech, with the ability to assess interdependencies, manage details, adhere to deadlines, and follow up on action itemsCommunity Outreach: Previous experience working in partnership with community based organizations and supporting customer adoption of new technologiesAdaptability: Ability to be flexible in approach and pivot when necessary to achieve project objectivesCommunication: Ability to communicate clearly and effectively with and between internal teams and external stakeholdersInitiative: Actively seeks and identifies opportunities to contribute to and achieve department goalsProblem solving: Identifies the root cause of the problem, potential impact and implications; proposes potential solutions to the VP, Innovation PilotsPreferred Qualifications:Proficient in Spanish (written and spoken)Awareness of marketing strategies focused on customer engagement, community outreach and utilizationUnderstanding of project implementation requirements with city and county governmentsFamiliarity with different communities and neighborhoods across LA CountyExperience with conflict resolutionExperience with grant application and management at Federal and State levelHigh-level knowledge of zero emission transportation, clean energy, and circular economy solutions Work RequirementsHyrbid work setting: Must work on site at our Downtown LA campus two to three days a week, occasional travel to meet with partners for Community Pilots.Position Details:This is a full-time position, starting immediately. LACI operates out of the La Kretz Innovation Campus, in the bustling Downtown LA Arts District. Since we are rapidly growing, you will be getting in on the ground floor at LACI, with the opportunity to evolve with us and shape your future here. Job DescriptionBASIC FUNCTION AND SCOPE OF RESPONSIBILITIESOperate, monitor and troubleshoot power and steam generation equipment for plant-wide operations.Essential ResponsibilitiesUnderstand basic principles of steam processes. Monitor, document and troubleshoot boiler, turbine, chemical pump, and steam system operations. Read and understand technical literature, drawings, gauges, instruments, etc. Keep accurate log sheets and records. Operate, troubleshoot and perform maintenance on equipment. Perform chemical testing and treatment of boiler water. Communicate effectively with other personnel. Perform repairs and preventative maintenance on all equipment. Make operational decisions based on available data. Keep work area clean at all times. Replenish fluids and chemicals for chemical pump and turbine systems. Demonstrate good attendance. Required to wear respirators and pass pulmonary function test. Must be able to climb stairs and ladders. Perform other job-related duties as assigned. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions of this position.EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS [Minimum level of formal education that is required to perform this job satisfactorily]Vocational School or some college courses preferred.Training, Skills, Knowledge And ExperienceKnowledge and skill equivalent to completion of high school, with 2 years work experience. Experience with water treatment and chemical analysis. Mechanical aptitude, understanding of electrical systems and computer proficiency is required. Requires technical certificate and/or turbo machinery, steam and boiler technical certificate or equivalent experience. Requires above average mathematical skill. Preferred certification or related experience: Boiler and Steam System operation, Maintenance and Compressed Air System operation. Preferred general knowledge of: Preventive Maintenance Procedures, Hydraulics/Pneumatics, Mechanical Drives and Linkages, Electro-Mechanical Systems, Industrial Control Systems, Troubleshooting skills and Machining and Welding skills. Must be physically able to perform the essential job functions.Non-essential FunctionsOperate forklift- requires valid forklift license. Operate other equipment when necessary. Participate in the CCJ Safeteam and Qualitivity programs. Train new employees. Learn other jobs in the functional area.EQUIPMENTRespirator, air pack, valves, hand tools, freezer wear, face shield, goggles, thermal and chemical gloves, earplugs, bump cap, safety glasses, steam rated protective clothing and or PPE.WORKING CONDITIONSWork is performed both in and out of doors. Requires exposure to temperature extremes, moving equipment, heights, high noise levels, wetness, vibrations, fumes, dust, etc. Work is performed on rotating shifts.For more information regarding working conditions, please review Cutrale’s Health, Safety and Environmental Handbook or the Job Hazard Analysis for this position.

Job DescriptionSCOPE AND PURPOSE:Resident Services Administrator is responsible for providing administrative support to the Community Manager by handling Office of the Building operations in accordance with the standards set forth by Douglas Emmett.DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: Include but are not limited to the following, as other duties or projects may be assigned.GENERAL OPERATIONSGreet visitors to the office. Answer telephones. Dispatch engineering to handle tenant service requests. Follow up on tenant requests to confirm timely completion of work. Open, date stamp and distribute mail and deliveries.. Contact tenants who are late paying rent. Prepare tenant memosPrepare monthly reports including leasing report, stacking plan, deal list, tenant contact list, emergency contact list and delinquency report for Community Manager review and approval. Coordinate tenant welcome packets and tenant events with Community Manager and vendors. Research and make recommendations to Community Manager for more cost-effective and efficient methods of performing administrative duties. Special projects as directed by Community Manager. Supervisory ResponsibilitiesNoneTECHNICAL PREREQUISITESMust have high school diploma or GEDMust have intermediate level knowledge of Word and Excel. Strong written and verbal communication skills. Projects a professional image by meeting Douglas Emmett dress code standards. Ability to communicate in a clear, positive and professional manner with tenants, employees and vendors. Ability to exercise good judgment and professional demeanor when interacting with building management, tenants and vendors. Ability to work well under pressure, prioritize multiple tasks and consistently produce high-quality accurate work. Team player attitude. Strong customer service orientation. Physical RequirementsPrimarily sedentary work involving regular use of keyboard and telephone. Should be able to sit for long periods of time. Occasionally ascend stairs or step stool. Occasionally lift and carry 5 – 10 pound parcels. Periodically deliver correspondence to tenants within the building. MACHINES, TOOLS, EQUIPMENT, AND WORK AIDS UTILIZED IN THIS POSITIONComputerCopy MachineTelephoneTwo-way radioPagerFax10-key adding machinePaper cutterStep stoolCompany DescriptionDouglas Emmett operates approximately 18 million square feet of Class A office space and over 5,000 luxury apartment units in nine highly desirable submarkets in Los Angeles County, six of which are located in Los Angeles' Westside - Brentwood, Century City, Santa Monica, Beverly Hills, the Olympic Corridor, and Westwood - and three submarkets in the San Fernando Valley - Sherman Oaks/Encino, Warner Center/Woodland Hills, and Burbank. The Company's Honolulu office portfolio is located in the downtown central business district with multifamily properties in nearby suburban communities.The Company utilizes the same focused business strategy that was implemented by its founding principals - managing, developing, redeveloping, and acquiring multifamily and commercial real estate in high barrier-to-entry submarkets that exhibit strong economic characteristics such as population and job growth, as well as inherent supply constraints, such as limited developable land due to natural and political barriers. The Company strives to capitalize on the experience of its seasoned management team to create continued value.Douglas Emmett operates approximately 18 million square feet of Class A office space and over 5,000 luxury apartment units in nine highly desirable submarkets in Los Angeles County, six of which are located in Los Angeles' Westside - Brentwood, Century City, Santa Monica, Beverly Hills, the Olympic Corridor, and Westwood - and three submarkets in the San Fernando Valley - Sherman Oaks/Encino, Warner Center/Woodland Hills, and Burbank. full description: Job DescriptionPosition: Health & Safety TechnicianEnvironmental Waste Minimization Inc. is a full-service environmental services and construction company servicing the Mid Atlantic region as well as national clients. This position will report to the Northampton, PA office but will primarily be in the field overseeing Health & Safety on job sites.Duties and Responsibilities:Project assignments include providing health & safety oversight on field projects involving hazardous waste, confined space entry, Haz Mat emergencies and other environmental remediation and construction work.Conduct and coordinate on-site inspections to audit physical conditions and safe work practices.Develop and implement controls for hazardous conditions and practices.Developing site-specific health & safety plansAssist in the development of specialized education and training materials.Conduct specialized safety training including site daily tailgate meetings.Completes all required permits for job sites.Assist in new employee occupational health and safety orientation.Coordinate compliance activities and other duties as assigned.Other duties assigned by managementMust possess strong computer and math skills along with strong interpersonal and verbal communication skills.Must be self-motivated and able to work independently.Attend and successfully complete related specialized and technical training and education seminars/classes that will relate directly to this positionRequirements include extended overnight travel.Reports directly to the H&S Director.RequirementsAssociate or Bachelor degree in a Safety related field a plus or 1-3 years of industry experienceSafety and Industry related Certifications are a plus.40 hour HAZWOPER a plusMust be able to lift 50 lbs and pass an OSHA physical with respiratory clearanceWe are an Equal Opportunity EmployerCompany DescriptionEnvironmental Waste Minimization, Inc. is an environmental service company with a highly recognized reputation for expertise in all areas of environmental field services, waste disposal, emergency response, demolition, industrial services and remediation. Job Title: Project Manager - Commercial Interiors ConstructionCompany: General Contractor based in Manhattan, NYExperience: 10+ Years in Commercial ConstructionSalary Range: $140,000 - $170,000Benefits: Medical Coverage, 401k, Paid Time Off (PTO)Job Description:As a Project Manager specialising in Commercial Interiors Construction, you will be an integral part of our dynamic team based in Manhattan, NY. We are a reputable General Contractor committed to delivering high-quality commercial interiors projects, and we are seeking an experienced and dedicated professional to join us in our mission. The successful candidate will demonstrate strong leadership skills, exceptional project management abilities, and a deep understanding of commercial construction processes.Responsibilities:Project Management: Lead and oversee all aspects of commercial interiors construction projects from inception to completion, ensuring adherence to budgets, schedules, and quality standards.Client Relations: Serve as the primary point of contact for clients, architects, engineers, subcontractors, and other stakeholders throughout the project lifecycle, fostering positive relationships and addressing concerns promptly and effectively.Budgeting and Cost Control: Develop and manage project budgets, monitor expenses, and implement cost-saving measures while maintaining profitability and client satisfaction.Scheduling and Resource Management: Create detailed project schedules, coordinate resources, and manage subcontractors to ensure timely project delivery and efficient utilisation of manpower and materials.Quality Assurance: Implement and enforce rigorous quality control measures to uphold the highest standards of craftsmanship and compliance with building codes, regulations, and project specifications.Risk Management: Identify potential risks and proactively implement mitigation strategies to minimise project disruptions, delays, and cost overruns.Team Leadership: Supervise and motivate project teams, providing guidance, mentorship, and support to ensure collaboration, productivity, and professional development.Contract Administration: Review and negotiate contracts, change orders, and subcontracts, ensuring clarity, accuracy, and alignment with project requirements and objectives.Documentation and Reporting: Maintain accurate project documentation, including progress reports, meeting minutes, RFIs, and submittals, and communicate project status, milestones, and issues to stakeholders regularly.Safety and Compliance: Promote a culture of safety on-site, enforce OSHA regulations and best practices, conduct regular safety inspections, and implement corrective actions as necessary to maintain a safe working environment for all personnel.Qualifications:Bachelor's degree in Construction Management, Engineering, Architecture, or related field (preferred).10+ years of experience in commercial construction, with a focus on interiors projects.Proven track record of successfully managing multiple projects simultaneously, ranging in size and complexity, within budget and schedule constraints.Strong knowledge of construction methods, materials, and building codes, particularly in the commercial interiors sector.Excellent communication, negotiation, and conflict resolution skills, with the ability to interact effectively with diverse stakeholders.Proficiency in project management software (e.g., Procore, Primavera, MS Project) and MS Office suite.PMP or similar certification (desired).Demonstrated leadership ability, with a results-oriented mindset and a commitment to fostering a collaborative and inclusive team environment.If you are a proactive, detail-oriented professional with a passion for delivering exceptional construction projects and exceeding client expectations, we invite you to apply for this rewarding opportunity. Join our team and be part of shaping the skyline of Manhattan with innovative and inspiring commercial interiors constructions.
