Job DescriptionJob Title: N.E Service DirectorCompensation - $100,000 annually plus annual performance-based bonus opportunityThe service director is responsible for all aspects of service delivery for the iPower customer base and will report directly to the President. The service director will oversee all helpdesk, field service technicians, and dispatch staff for the northeastern geographic iPower service region. *YOU MUST HAVE MSP EXPERIENCE* The overall service direction of the region will be established and managed by the service director.Job Duties Include:Oversee and manage the helpdesk and field service technical staff: Create the overall expectations and core values that are required from the team Continual training and development of the staff Create expectations and performance incentivesPerform annual reviews that: Recap employee performance based on specific objectives and KPI’s Set expectations and goals for the upcoming year Create a team driven environment that promotes continuity and teamwork Enhance, develop and implement systems that promote employee retention, growth, reliability, and task ownership.  Manage and re-route tickets/issues that require a different set of resources. Direct tickets/issues to the appropriate department – for example, sales, project management, senior engineers, accounting, etc. Resolve overall issues with the support system: Ensure all tickets are issued in a prompt manner Ensure all tickets are assigned to an appropriate technician in a prompt manner Ensure technicians reach out to a client within the minimum required response time Ensure all tickets are reviewed for accuracy in contract application, pricing, and time Ensure all tickets are promptly closed and invoiced in the systemTime Management: Ensure all employees record their time accurately in Connectwise and the Payroll System Payroll system accuracy ensures that employees are paid accurately and that we keep in compliance with labor laws Manage all on call requirements and tickets to ensure that we meet customer expectations and compensate the technicians appropriately Connectwise accuracy ensures that our reporting requirements (time spent on tickets, overall time allocation, agreement profitability, etc.) are accurately portrayed. Technician expense approval: Set expectations for what technicians can or cannot submit for expenses – i.e., supplies, meals, etc. Data analysis: Develop quarterly business reviews (QBR’s) for major customers Collect data that may be needed for service histories, SLA’s, etc. Monitor the help desk for what needs improving on a regular basis: Be conscious of the challenges the help desk faces on a regular basis and develop ways to help mitigate these challengesStaff Management: Recruit new technicians based on the need of the company Develop a comprehensive and results driven training plan Create job descriptions and expectations for staff Monitor performance on a regular basis Work with HR when needed to develop disciplinary plans for employeesManage Connectwise Ticketing Platform: Ensure the system is set up appropriately to capture the issue type and status of the ticket, as well as, work flows, SLA reminders, etc. that are appropriate in managing the life cycle of a ticket.  Ensure resource time is accurately reflected on these tickets. Management of the dispatch manager: Ongoing development of this position Gain an in-depth knowledge of each technician and what their abilities and qualifications are Dispatch calls to appropriate technicians Escalate calls to the next level when appropriate Manage subcontractor requirements and ticket statusTake ownership of the service department as an individual profit center: Understand the various aspects of revenue Analyze the costs incurred by the service department and develop ways to decrease the costs or get more out of the existing resources Develop ways that the service department can contribute to the bottom line Ensure that we are properly billing for all chargeable service ticketsCustomer Interaction: Work directly with customers when needed Give white glove service to major accounts (you should know these by heart) and follow up when excessive tickets are being logged and we are not meeting our SLA’s Follow up with any customer who has given us a poor mark on the smile back program Identify areas where our service team failed and follow up with the customer to ensure their issue has been resolved and they are satisfied with the end resultWork with other departments to enhance continuity between departments: Identify areas of communication gaps Work with managers in the other department to improve data and operational accuracyContinually increase your knowledge and expertise in the Connectwise Software: Ensure all tickets and time are closed out by the end of the month deadline All completed tickets should be closed out and approved the day before the end of the month On the last day of the month, tickets need to be kept up with on an hourly basis and closed out promptly so we record the costs. Requirements:This is an in office, non-remote position. The company will require you to work out of the existing TGI/iPower offices as much as possible. The expectation will be that you have a primary office in West Caldwell, NJ and will travel on a consistent basis and further as needed to the Brooklyn NY office to support the iPower staff in that location.iPower provides support to its customers 24/7. It will be the responsibility of the Service Director to participate in a predetermined rotation for on-call night and weekend support. This includes ensuring that iPower’s scheduled on-call technicians are available and responding to calls on nights and weekends. It is the Service Director’s duty to properly schedule and ensure there are technicians available for after-hours service.Benefits: Dental insurance, Health insurance, Vision Insurance, PTO, and 401(k)Job Type: Full-timeAnnual Bonus:iPower will offer an annual performance-based bonus, based upon the achievement of certain key factors and objectives, such as: Service Response Times Client Satisfaction Client Retention Client Smile Back Scores/CSAT Personal Retention and Development Service Dept ImprovementsEEO Statement We are an equal employment opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law.

company: Mount Dora Area Chamber of Commerce
full description: Job DescriptionIf you like communicating with people, actively utilize social media for Business, have a flair for creative marketing, and if you would like to further develop your skills, this job is for you! This position will be responsible for the development and implementation of all Chamber marketing strategies, communications, advertising, and PR activities working closely with the President. This position is designed to be an entry to mid-level position, however other levels will be considered. Please note 70% of this job will be creative marketing with 30% working with visitors, members and misc tasks. You will be part of a team and as such, you will wear many hats!ResponsibilitiesChamber’s “Staff Reporter”, gathering facts, interesting stories, and promoting MembersCoordination and production of member email blasts and general membership communicationsDevelop and maintain member services materials, visitor/relocation map, and Member DirectoryProduction and maintenance of the Chamber’s electronic marketing and informational pieces, including e-blasts, e-news blogs, and creative social posts.Ability to demonstrate proficient utilization of the internet, including current & emerging social media platforms (Instagram, Facebook, LinkedIn, YouTube, etc)Take photographs and video, in horizontal and vertical formats, for use in materials and social.Administrator for organization website and database/web management program via ChamberMaster, and WordPress sitesShooting and editing video for promotion of businesses, tourism and events.Write and/or edit press releases to promote Members, Mount Dora Tourism & Chamber EventsDevelop and maintain complete media lists and implement plans to reach focused influencersDesired Background, skills, and abilities:Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Canva, Constant Contact, ChamberMaster, WordPress, and Adobe Creative Suite, Professional video editing via Final Cut Pro/PremierExcellent listening and strong communication skills, both verbal and writtenTime management and organizational skillsKnowledge of Mount Dora & Lake County (or willingness to learn) to communicate “what to do” to visitors.Assist with answering phones/walk-in customers as neededPreferred by not required:Experience working with volunteersExperience working with not-for-profit organizationsKnowledge of Mount DoraAdditional Responsibilities:Other tasks as requested by the chamber president. Valid Driver’s License with an acceptable driving record.Work Hours:Generally, 5 days a week, due to the nature of the position a portion of the employee’s time will be outside the normal 9 to 5. Flexible availability is a requirement for this position. (including nights, weekends, and holidays on occasion)Physical Demands:This is continual light work and occasional heavy work. Could require walking and standing for extended periods, frequent stooping, bending and reaching, lifting/pushing/pulling up to 30 pounds. Work may be performed in adverse environmental conditions (heat, cold, rain, etc.)Company DescriptionThe Mount Dora Area Chamber of Commerce mission is to support, promote and empower its members. Company DescriptionEpic Forensics and Engineering, Inc. is a full-service engineering firm based out of West Palm Beach, Florida. The main focus of the firm is to provide expert engineering representation, be it forensic investigation design or construction, for a vast realm of clients, both in the public and private sectors. Job DescriptionDMF Marketing values collaboration, creativity, initiative, and performance. We are seeking a full-time Training & Education Leader to join our team. As the Training & Education Leader, you will fulfill various duties and responsibilities, including organizing, administering, and scheduling training sessions both internally for new employees of DMF and externally for our channel of customers and sales representatives. You will report to the Director of Commercial Growth and work collaboratively with all DMF departments to prepare training action plans, allocate resources, and execute within allotted timeframes.This is an onsite role, expected to be in-office 5 days per week.Responsibilities include: The Training & Education Leader will be responsible for designing, implementing, and executing various training and development programs both internal and external to DMF Lighting, planning programs from start to finish including identifying learning objectives, content, methods, resources, timelines, and evaluation criteria.Internal to DMF: New employee on-boarding establish 30-60-90 day knowledge expectations of our industry, product, and internal processesWork with Department Heads to develop a curriculum specific to each role that should be trained and covered during the onboarding process that aligns with the strategic objectives of the company. Work with Department Heads to identify and execute continuous education opportunities for personnel professional and industry-specific growth opportunities, and seek out new toolsConduct new product launch training for internal training on features, process changes, and marketing initiatives. Become an SME on Internal software tools (Oracle, Expensify, Navan, Box, etc.)Work with Human Resources to identify company-wide training that could be necessary and to the benefit of the organization and company culture. External to DMF Lead weekly live online customer product demonstrations & training from the DMF StudioManage new rep onboarding training. Manage 1 on 1 virtual training when our reps add new employees to their teams. Manage product training section of in-person customer & rep visits. Advise on the structure and messaging of the in-person training curriculum of other presenters to be most effective. Develop training materials forProduct LaunchesDMF Self-Service ToolsProcesses (where needed)Specific Stakeholders (Contractors, Distributors, Lighting Designers, Architects, Engineers, End Users, Interior Designers)Specific Market Verticals (Hospitality, Multifamily, Healthcare, Education, Residential)Self Service Tools Training for external stakeholders. Monitor and evaluate the effectiveness of program implementation by creating and maintaining comprehensive documentation, plans, and reports related to training initiatives with corresponding KPIs. To succeed in this role, the Training & Education Leader will require excellent time management and communication skills, as you will collaborate with various internal teams to deliver results within deadlines and have a vision to creatively approach disseminating the wealth of institutional knowledge those at DMF have to digestible pieces that will stay with our team. Ultimately, the Training Manager’s role is to ensure internally and externally DMF is effectively training our internal staff, extended sales force (reps), and customers (specifiers, contractors, distributors).Requirements: 5-7 years of proven work experience preferably as a training or development manager in a corporate field or parallel experience in the education field or the lighting industryStrong organizational skills, including multitasking and time management with the ability to meet deadlines and the leadership prowess to execute. Outstanding communication, emotional intelligence, and interpersonal skills capable of maintaining strong relationships. Thorough understanding of adult learning principles, instructional design techniques, and evaluation methodsStrong written & verbal communication and presentation skillsConfidence in public speaking both on camera and via in-person presentations. Experience with developing training materials & processes to track and evaluate effectiveness. BS or BA in a related field, education, communication, human resources10-15% travel required annually. Chief Growth Officer This position requires at least 10 years of hands on fundraising experience, diversifying revenue. Our client, Children at Risk, seeks a Chief Growth Officer (CGO). The CGO is a trusted advisor to the CEO and senior team to deliver personalized, superior, measurable long-term performance and capabilities. The CGO also provides leadership and strategic direction to the organization to create relationships that drive sustainable growth, increase revenue, and expand the organization's impact. address key issues proactively, and establish an annual reporting methodology for internal and external audiences.Work in concert with the agency’s Board of Directors and CEO to identify, cultivate, and personally solicit individuals and organizations who can make annual major gifts to meet or exceed strategic goals.Implement a comprehensive planned giving program; cultivate and solicit planned gifts to meet or exceed strategic goals.Conduct market analysis and identify new opportunities for expansion and revenue generation.Establish and develop strategic relationships with community organizations, businesses, and other stakeholders to support the organization’s growth objectives.Negotiate and manage partnerships that align with the organization’s mission and values.Lead and ensure performance, strategy, and alignment of all growth efforts.Use data and analytics to assess the effectiveness of growth initiatives in marketing, fund development, strategic partnerships, and grants, making data-driven decisions.Provide effective and inspiring leadership, collaboration, and clear direction to department staff, which includes attraction, professional development, and retention of diverse, growth-minded, top professionals.Deliver seamless experience across physical and digital environments that anticipates prospect, donor, and partner needs and integrates broader engagement.Develop, monitor, and forecast revenue pipelines across the organization.Establish KPI framework and methodology for measuring team revenue generating success and forecasting.Cultivate strategic partnerships with diverse communities to maximize C@R’s reach and to grow new business and funding opportunities.Manage revenue operations, ensuring teams are enabled with the right technology, organizational structure, processes, and documentation to deliver exceptional experiences to donor segments.Monitor marketplace and analyze opportunities, synthesizing competitive analysis delivered by product and marketing, enabling the organizational programs to succeed in a sustainable way.Collaborate with internal teams on messaging, strategies, and business models to achieve revenue goals.Partner with other members of the Sr. team to develop and advance inclusive and connected fundraising strategies and practices.Engage C@R’s leaders in cultivating, soliciting, and stewarding philanthropic partner prospects and selected principal prospects.Serve as a champion, articulating the importance of fundraising to all internal and external stakeholders.Qualifications: Proven experience in a senior leadership role, preferably in a nonprofit.Proven track record of growing revenue through new business ventures, philanthropic stewardship, institutional giving, marketing, branding, and partnerships.Excellent relationship skills, forming trust-based relationships with diverse benefactors, trustees, and other stakeholders.Excellent communicator: builds trusted relationships and clearly articulates key value propositions, processes, and performance.Experience working effectively with diverse and historically marginalized individuals and job title: IT Know it All Field Technician
full description: Job DescriptionWe would like to offer you an opportunity to tell other people how to use their computers. You can show them how much you know, and how little they do. Afterwards you can make jokes about the users and enjoy the laughter of our team. You can do all of that in the picturesque Five-Towns area of Long Island.You would be showing off your knowledge with the followingMicrosoft Windows – All versions. *If you claim to know Windows NT you will be tested thoroughlyMicrosoft Office * Open Office doesn’t count, even if everyone knows it’s faster, better, etc etc etcNetworks, Firewalls, Switches. *Yes, we know you set one of those up for your aunt’s dog walkerVirus / Spyware Removal *Computers get those on their own, even when users didn’t do anything wrongMastery of English Language * How else would you be able to show off your knowledge?At times you will have to visit the people in person, for that you would need a CAR and a VALID DRIVER’S LICENSES. SENIOR FIELD EXECUTIVE JOB DESCRIPTIONThe Astral Health & Beauty Senior Field Executive leads and oversees a team of Regional Field Executives and plays a crucial role in driving sales growth and expanding our market presence. This position will develop and execute effective strategies and build strong relationships with key stakeholders. The Astral Health & Beauty Senior Field Executive must be an exceptional leader, have a deep understanding of sales processes, and a passion for the health and beauty industry.  KEY RESPONSIBILITIESTeam Leadership:Lead, inspire, and mentor a high-performing field sales team.Provide guidance and support to a team of Regional Field Executives to drive revenue and team growth.Sales Strategy:Develop and implement sales strategies and initiatives to meet or exceed sales targets and revenue growth, while continuously optimizing processes for improved efficiency.Drive customer engagement initiatives, including events, promotions, and brand experiences.Analyze market trends and customer needs to identify new business opportunities.Relationship ManagementCultivate and maintain strong relationships with key clients, retailers, and distributors.Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure alignment of sales initiatives with overall business goals.Training and Development: Develop and conduct training programs for Regional Field Executives to enhance their product knowledge and sales skills.Provide support and guidance to Regional Field Executives, assisting with sales, product knowledge, and customer interactions.Performance Management: Set clear sales goals, track team performance, and provide regular feedback and coaching to drive individual team success.Define and track key performance metrics for field operations, sales, and marketing initiatives.Territory Management: Oversee territory assignments, ensuring comprehensive coverage and optimal allocation of resources to maximize sales potential.Gather market intelligence, analyze trends, and provide actionable insights to support informed decision-making and strategic planning.Reporting and Analysis: Generate regular reports on sales metrics, performance, and market trends to evaluate progress and identify areas for improvement. QUALIFICATIONSBachelor’s degree in Marketing, Business Administration, or a related field is preferred.7+ years of progressive sales experience, including at least 3 years in a leadership or managerial role within the health and beauty industry.Proven ability to lead, motivate, and develop high-performing sales teams, with a track record of achieving and surpassing sales targets.Excellent communication, presentation, and negotiation skills, with the ability to build rapport and influence at all levels.Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and adapt to changing market conditions. ABOUT ASTRAL HEALTH & BEAUTYAstral Health & Beauty has established itself as a leading authority in natural and plant-based skin care and color cosmetics. We’re the name behind a family of high-quality, ingredient-driven beauty brands dedicated to innovation. Founded in 1998 and headquartered in Atlanta, Georgia, our groundbreaking, multi-brand beauty company operates through a portfolio of four distinct brands: Aloette, COSMEDIX, PÜR and butter LONDON—all of which are proudly cruelty-free. From skin care and makeup, to body care and 8-Free nail lacquers, we offer an array of innovative solutions designed to deliver superior results people can feel good about. With innovative and transformative beauty, skincare products and more, our Astral mission is to redefine the face of clean beauty. SQL Developer - Remote Job, 1+ Year ExperienceAnnual Income: $55K - $65KA valid work permit is necessary in the US/CanadaAbout us: Patterned Learning is a platform that aims to help developers code faster and more efficiently. It offers features such as collaborative coding, real-time multiplayer editing, and the ability to build, test, and deploy directly from the browser. The platform also provides tightly integrated code generation, editing, and output capabilities.Description:As an SQL Developer, you will play a crucial role in designing, implementing, and optimizing database solutions, enabling efficient data storage, retrieval, and manipulation. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data requirements and deliver effective solutions that meet our clients needs. This is a unique opportunity to work on diverse projects, tackle complex data challenges, and make a significant impact in the world of data.Responsibilities:Collaborate with stakeholders to gather data requirements and translate them into efficient SQL queries, stored procedures, and functions. Design, develop, and maintain database schemas, ensuring data integrity, security, and performance. Write complex SQL queries for data extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) processes. Optimize SQL queries and database performance, identifying and resolving bottlenecks and inefficiencies. Develop data validation and quality assurance processes to ensure accuracy and reliability. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate SQL code into applications and reporting systems. Conduct data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and insights that drive business decisions. Stay up-to-date with the latest trends and advancements in SQL and database technologies. Requirements:Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field. Proven experience as an SQL Developer or Database Developer, working with complex databases. Strong proficiency in SQL and experience with relational databases (e.g., MySQL, Oracle, SQL Server). Solid understanding of database design principles, data modeling, and normalization. Proficiency in writing complex SQL queries, stored procedures, and functions. Experience with performance optimization and tuning of SQL queries and database indexing. Familiarity with ETL processes and tools (e.g., SSIS, Informatica) is a plus. Knowledge of data warehousing concepts and dimensional modeling is desirable. Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to analyze complex data requirements. Excellent attention to detail and a commitment to delivering high-quality solutions. Effective communication and collaboration skills to work with cross-functional teams. Why Patterned Learning LLC?Patterned Learning can provide intelligent suggestions, automate repetitive tasks, and assist developers in writing code more effectively. This can help reduce coding errors, improve productivity, and accelerate the development process.The pattern recognition is particularly relevant in the context of coding. Neural networks, especially deep learning models, are commonly employed for pattern detection and classification tasks. These models simulate human decision-making and can identify patterns in data, making them well-suited for tasks like code analysis and generation.

Job DescriptionOne of the nation’s largest independent testing facilities seeks an Analytical Chemist with a minimum 2 years experience testing products for the pharmaceutical, nutritional cosmetic, personal care, medical device or allied industries. The position requires a working knowledge of testing products in a GMP regulated facility.Responsible for performing physical, chemical and instrumental techniques on APIs, raw materials and finished products according to schedule. Ability to learn new techniques, multitask, follow instructions and comply with SOPs. Self motivated and have the ability to work independently and as part of a team. Authorization to work in the United States indefinitely without restriction or sponsorship. Physical Requirements and Working Conditions:Ability to stand/sit in office and laboratory environment. Ability to use a personal computer and Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Outlook) experience required. Vision accuracy and color detection are required for this positionAbility to wear/use personal protective equipment as required such as lab coat, goggles, gloves, masks, etc. Ability to lift up to 30 lbs. Job DescriptionOn Call Program AssociatePart Time San FranciscoAgency OverviewFounded in 1889, the Felton Institute (formerly Family Service Agency of San Francisco) has a history of innovation in services for vulner­able children, families, and adults for 130 years. Felton’s mission is to respond to human needs with cutting edge social services and treatment that combine the best social science research with cultural sensitivity, a deep respect for the consumer, and a commitment to social justice. With over 46 programs in 15 languages at sites throughout the San Francisco Bay Area and surrounding counties, our comprehensive array of services reaches across all racial, ethnic, cultural, and linguistic lines. At the heart of our work is the belief that individuals and families in crisis must have access to services and resources to help them build on their inherent strengths and develop self-sufficiency. Felton offers a dynamic, challenging, and supportive work environment where staff is encouraged to increase their skills and enter new domains.Program DescriptionSan Francisco Suicide Prevention’s 24-hour Crisis Line provides immediate crisis intervention and emotional support to everyone who calls. Since 1962, we have been answering the telephone around the clock, whenever we are needed. We have been able to maintain this service for over fifty years through the wonderful dedication of over 200 trained individuals who volunteer their time to answer the phones and help their neighbors through a crisis. All volunteers are trained and supervised by a professional staff, and all receive ongoing training to hone their skills with the newest developments in the field of suicide prevention.Position OverviewProvide overnight, weekend and various shifts coverage on all SFSP’s 24-hour hotlines and all crisis lines. This position reports to and adheres to agency’s policies/procedures and programs.Specific Duties And Responsibilities (Essential Functions)Service DeliveryAnswer calls from clients calling the Crisis lines or Access Line. Assess callers needs and provide emotional support in a non-judgmental manner. Empower callers to look at options and make their own decisions. Provide information and referrals to callers when appropriate. Assess suicide risks and determine plan of action. Provide Access Line Intake and referral support if working Access Line. Provide crisis intervention and emergency services as needed. TeamworkWelcome, help train and support volunteers on the hotlines as needed. Participate in continuing education presentations as needed. Contribute to a positive work environment and culture by showing respect to co-workers and engaging in positive team dynamics by concentrating on work duties engage in pro agency work culture. Compliance & QARecord client contacts database and communicate concerns to Supervisor Enters participant information by inputting alphabetic and numeric data on system. Maintains data entry requirements by following data program techniques and procedures. Keep files and data secured to protect participant confidentiality. Ensures compliance with legal/ethical and confidentiality standards. Performs other duties as assigned by the Program Director or Supervisor. QualificationsMust successfully complete SFSP Crisis Line Volunteer training program or equivalent prior experience. AA in social work, psychology or related area, or similar education or training in suicide prevention / mental health. Must have demonstrated successful performance and experience on the Crisis Lines. Ability to communicate well, both verbally and in writing. Ability to work independently and with others. Attention to detail. Experience working with vulnerable populations. Experience with crisis interventions, suicide callers and call center work Demonstrate ability to engage and support clients with challenging situations and suicide ideation Able to manage emotions and reactions to different situations. Stays calm and clear under pressure. Ability to work effectively both individually and as part of a diverse team. Experience with evidence-based practices and de-escalating clients Able to exercise good judgment and maintain healthy boundaries with clients and staff. Able to stay awake and alert during shift Strong computer skills: MS office, data entry, write clear and accurate narrative reports

Job DescriptionJob Description The Purchasing Manager will manage procurement of all site material (including subcontracts), equipment and services necessary for manufacturing and ensures efficient movement of materials required for meeting production schedules. Job DescriptionTitle: Field Service Technician (High Voltage)Shift: Day Shift, will be traveling domestically around the US and sometimes internationallyPay: $27.00 to $30.00+/hr, perks included with travelingWho we are:Our client manufactures custom magnetics including transformers, reactors, chokes, inductors, and custom enclosures. They are looking to grow their team at their facility near Warren, OH.Field Service Technician (High Voltage) Role:We are looking for a field service technician that will be traveling to customer sites to assist with machines and equipment. This will include travel around the United States and internationally.Field Service Technician (High Voltage) Responsibilities:Installation, repair, and maintenance of induction power supplies, coils, furnaces, refractory linings, water systems, hydraulic systems, pneumatic systems, material handling equipment, and PLCs. Works with AC circuitry ranging from 480 to in excess of 3000 VAC, and DC circuitry ranging from 680 – 3,000 VDC. Good customer relation skills, as pertaining to the servicing of such equipment, are also required. Complete service reports using Microsoft Word, and expense reports using Microsoft Excel. Travel is mandatory, domestic and international, as necessary to perform these services in our customers' sites, and may be as much as 80% of the time on the job with occasional travel in excess of 4 weeks continuous. As required, train less experienced personnel, handle customer calls, look up customer drawings, and assist the Service Department support staff in any way necessary during the normal course of business. May also be required to work in assembly or test departments, and perform other duties as assigned by his/her direct supervisor. Accountability and good judgment are vital to this position. Mature decision making is a desired quality. Decisions are required; employee must analyze facts and determine action using a wide range of procedures but within limits of standard practice. Must fully understand the complete realm of safety issues associated with working on high-voltage electrical circuitry, and with working in industrial locations. Additionally, must make sound judgments with respect to company liability issues. Must understand that as a Service Engineer he/she is the most visible employee of the client that a customer sees, and good interpersonal skills are a very important part of this job. The employee must be able to deal with a variety of different persons under high stress conditions and must be able to assure those customers of their ability, as a representative of the client, to solve their problems. Must dress and act per company policies and use good business practices. Must follow all company procedure, and use discretion and good judgment with regard to confidential information pertaining to Customers, Company plans, designs, blueprints, development programs, etc. Will be in possession of company owned equipment and must use good judgment in maintaining and protecting this equipment. All equipment must be returned to the client upon termination from employment for any reason. About You:A college degree in Electrical/Electronics Engineering Technology or equivalent is preferred One-year work experience in an industrial environment is desirable. Job DescriptionJob Title: Remote Professor/Lecturer of EconomicsLocation: Remote (Fall or Summer Program)Position Overview: We are seeking a qualified Professor/Lecturer in Economics to join our esteemed university abroad for a semester-long remote position. The ideal candidate must be a native English speaker and currently hold a position as a Professor or Lecturer at a globally recognized university within the top 10 to 500-600 rankings. This role requires expertise in both macro and microeconomics, and candidates must possess a Ph.D. degree in Economics.Responsibilities:Develop and deliver comprehensive lectures, seminars, and tutorials in macro and microeconomics, adhering to curriculum standards and learning objectives. Utilize innovative teaching methods and technology to engage students in remote learning environments effectively. Provide constructive feedback and support to students to enhance their understanding and critical thinking skills in economics. Stay updated on current trends, research, and developments in the field of economics and integrate relevant insights into teaching materials. Mentor and guide students in their academic pursuits, including research projects, papers, and presentations. Collaborate with Scholege staff to ensure the delivery of high-quality educational programs and experiences. Maintain necessary communication with students through virtual office hours, email, and online platforms to address their queries and concerns. Qualifications:Ph.D. degree in Economics from a reputable institution. Currently teaching the course at a Globally Ranked Top 10-500-600 university or college. Demonstrated expertise and teaching experience in both macro and microeconomics at the university level. Native English speaker with strong communication and presentation skills. Proficiency in utilizing technology for remote teaching, including video conferencing, learning management systems, and online collaboration tools. Commitment to fostering an inclusive and diverse learning environment that encourages student engagement and success. Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a remote setting, demonstrating adaptability and flexibility. Strong organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple tasks and deadlines effectively. Job DescriptionResponsibilities: Assist with research, analysis, and implementation of various client billing requirements including but not limited to, billing rate arrangements, phase/task coding, and timekeeper approval.  Process requests from various departments in the billing system to update client and matter settings.  Monitor and update various client discount arrangements; including setting tracking alerts.  Entry and upkeep of client arrangements in firm deal database.  Assist with year end and ad hoc updates to client and timekeeper changes in billing rate arrangements. full description: DescriptionPosition at Franklin EnergyCOMPANY SUMMARY As a combined organization, Franklin Energy and AM Conservation Group is undertaking what is perhaps the central challenge of our times – to help drive the transition to net-zero carbon economies while ensuring that no working families, businesses, or local communities are left behind. To do that, we are the utility industry’s top provider of turn-key energy efficiency and grid optimization programs and products, all of which contribute to reducing carbon and waste and, at the same time, free-up resources for creating more innovation investment and jobs. With over 26 years in business, we have more than 1,300 experts across the United States, with warehouses on both coasts. The organization’s integrated in-house services provide deep personalization and insights, helping energy partners achieve their carbon-reduction and energy productivity goals. We believe the organization’s most “precious resources” are its people. We pledge a relentless pursuit to embody a culture that acknowledges, recognizes, and infinitely seeks to understand the unique differences of its people. We are committed to creating employee experiences that continually attract and embrace a multiracial, multicultural, and multigenerational workforce that promotes outstanding performance and mirrors our diverse partnerships, clients and communities we serve.POSITION SUMMARY As the People Data & Analytics Specialist, you’ll play a pivotal role in shaping our HR strategy. Your insights will directly impact leadership decisions, driving our company toward strategic goals. We’re seeking an adaptable, proactive, and collaborative individual who thrives in ambiguity and is passionate about leveraging data to create meaningful change.ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES This list of duties and responsibilities is not all-inclusive and may be expanded to include other duties and responsibilities, as management may deem necessary from time to time.HR Metrics Mastery: Dive deep into our HR data. Compile, interpret, and analyze key metrics related to talent acquisition, retention, and employee engagement. Your insights will guide our leadership, including the Board of Directors.Trendspotter Extraordinaire: Identify critical people trends using advanced HR analytics and external best practices. Translate these insights into customized tactics that drive desired behaviors and business outcomes.Retention Whisperer: Keep a close eye on turnover and retention rates. Collaborate with our People and Culture team to develop strategies that enhance employee satisfaction and reduce attrition.Data Alchemist: Use a mix of quantitative and qualitative methods (surveys, focus groups, database mining) to extract valuable information. Synthesize research data to inform key business initiatives.Survey Guru: Administer our HR survey platform. Create new surveys, update existing ones, and analyze results. Your work will directly impact our employee experience.Tech Savvy: Leverage HR systems to access and compile data efficiently. You’ll be the wizard behind the scenes, ensuring our data foundation is rock-solid.Scenario Weaver: Design flexible scenarios and models. Answer complex business questions by exploring different possibilities.Annual Increase Champion: Collaborate closely with the People and Culture team to define and communicate annual increase processes. Your expertise will shape our compensation strategy.Position RequirementsEducation and ExperienceBachelor’s degree or equivalent experience in HR, Business, Data Science, or a related field. Minimum 5 years’ experience in human resources, professional development, analytics, and/or compensation required.Required Skills, Knowledge, And AbilitiesProven experience in HR analytics, data modeling, and reporting.Proficiency in quantitative and qualitative research methods.Tech-savvy with HR systems and data management tools.Excellent communication skills—able to translate data insights into actionable recommendations with proactive collaboration across the company.Passion for continuous learning and staying ahead of industry trends.Collaborative and proactive in analyzing data with the ability to clearly explain the end results.Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.Committed to diversity and inclusion.Licenses & CertificationsValid state identification, including but not limited to driver’s license.Travel RequirementsWillingness to travel up to 10%.PHYSICAL DEMANDS AND WORK ENVIRONMENTRequired to sit, stand, walk; talk and hear; and ability to touch and handle typical office equipmentEmployee will have exposure to normal office environmentsRemote workers will maintain a home office environment free of reasonable distractions, with practices in place to protect sensitive employee dataNote: Reasonable accommodations may be made for individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions of this position. The above information describes the general duties and requirements necessary to perform the principal functions of the position. This shall not be construed as a detailed description of all the duties and requirements that may be necessary in this position.An Equal Opportunity EmployerFranklin Energy implements the use of dash cams inside their fleet of leased vehicles because the Company believes video surveillance devices (Dash Cams) promote the safety of employees as well as security within the company vehicles. The Company will not use video surveillance (Dash Cams) for any unlawful purpose including monitoring employees or giving the impression of monitoring. Our Dash Cam Policy applies to all employees of the Company and temporary agency employees, regardless of whether an employee or temporary agency employee may be driving or riding in Company Vehicles. The primary use of Dash Cams is to assist in the protection and safety of employees and property, prevention, and detection of criminal offenses such as vehicle vandalism and break-ins and staged-accident fraud, defense of legal claims, driver exoneration, and driver training and improvement.

The VITALSOLUTION Anesthesia Recruiter is a driving force behind creating visibility with Anesthesiologist and CRNA candidates who are interested in joining our practice management solution!Playing an end-to-end role (proactively sourcing, recruiting against requisitions, working through the full applicant tracking process), the Recruiter creatively sources, screens and recruits Anesthesiologist and CRNA candidates using self-generated candidate leads, leads received from our sourcing team and the company database. This role is responsible for making placements against immediate-term open requisitions, as well as nurturing long-term relationships with prospective candidates. Our culture and mentality is high-touch, and high-value – and we serve our candidates in representing just the right opportunity for their needs, at the right time.Similarly, we operate within a creative model for our clients – so the Recruiter needs to find candidates whose life demands and interests lend themselves to a long-term commitment to our model. and working knowledge of creative sourcing tools and strategiesExperience with contract negotiations with candidates, 1099 contracts, a plusExcellent communication skills and phone etiquetteDemonstrates strong interpersonal skills within a service environmentExcellent organization, prioritization and problem-solving skillsExercises accuracy and attention to detail, as well as discretionPHYSICAL DEMANDS AND WORK ENVIRONMENTMust have use of sensory skills to effectively communicate and interact with other employees and the public through use of the telephone, email, video conference and face to face contactMust have manual dexterity, visual acuity and hearing acuity to effectively use and operate office related equipment such as but not limited to a computer, copier, scanner, camera, phone, headset, keyboard and mouseMust be able to sit for extended periods of time at a keyboard and workstation with low periods of reaching and standingEQUAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY STATEMENTIngenovis Health is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace. They will need to generate and secure new sales revenue by prospecting and adding customers.Business Development Representative Responsibilities: Design an action plan to successfully create new business and build client relationships Create and maintain sales route records Manage the calendar, coordinate daily routes and review with management Perform sales calls resulting in scheduled meetings with target referral prospects Manage the calendar, coordinate daily routes and review with management Report leads to dispatch or book call Gain commitment from customers leading to referrals of those in need of restoration services Responsible for achieving company sales targets and update management on the status of accounts Opportunities for growth and potential to oversee sales staff Maintain a professional, ethical, and positive disposition as a primary representative of the company in the community Complete weekly and monthly sales reports in a timely manner Regularly attend client meetings, trade shows, networking events, conferences, etc.  Maintain customer contact database Make group presentations to prospect organizations Integrate sales efforts with other organized marketing activities (promotions, advertising, exhibitions, telemarketing, social media marketing, etc. ﻿Business Development Representative Requirements: 3+ years proven sales experience in a business development role, preferably outside sales Industry knowledge Established Book of Business is a + Results-driven and ability to work in a fast-paced environment with a demonstrated ability to multitask with a sense of urgency to make things happen Proven ability in creating and maintaining relationships with teammates and clients a must Strong communication, problem solving, and negotiations skills Self-motivated, trustworthy, confident, and organized﻿﻿Keywords: sales, business development, restoration, construction, marketing

About The Shoptaw GroupFounded in 1997, The Shoptaw Group is a private, real estate investment firm based in Atlanta, Georgia with a focus on investing in existing, high-quality multifamily properties throughout the Southeast. We pride ourselves in our reputation and long-standing relationships with our investors, business partners and peers across the industry. As a team, we consider integrity, honesty, diligence, adaptability, professionalism, open communication, and work/life balance as our highest values. The RoleAs the Asset Management Associate, you will be responsible for supporting and collaborating with the Vice President of Asset Management by performing various analytical, reporting, and oversight functions aimed at maximizing the profitability of the multifamily properties within The Shoptaw Group’s portfolio. Duties & Responsibilities Work closely with the Vice President of Asset Management to enhance property values, optimize operational efficiencies, and mitigate risks Oversee property-level operations by conducting weekly and monthly reviews, preparing and distributing monthly and quarterly asset management and financial reports, monitoring NOI and expense variances, and creating new reports for performance analysis Work with TSG’s third-party manager to ensure smooth operations of multifamily properties Assist in the review and analysis of property budgets Maintain and organize asset management files and records Oversight of contract and utility management of properties Ensure compliance of various city and county ordinances Assist with property acquisitions and dispositions through due diligence and closing processes Knowledge & Expertise 1-3 years of related experience; analyst experience preferred Strong working knowledge of the basic fundamentals of real estate, including but not limited to multifamily, interpreting accounting reports, operating reports, and market and demographic information Bachelor’s degree Proficiency in Microsoft Excel, other MS Office applications, and Adobe Acrobat. Yardi Voyager, revenue management software, and Workday Adaptive Planning experience preferred Characteristics Willingness to learn and collaborate with others Energetic, engaged, creative problem solver Tenacious, detail-oriented, shows initiative Strong organizational and time management skills Excellent intrapersonal and communication skillsBenefits Competitive Salary Hybrid work model Medical benefits including vision and dental Retirement/401k benefits Basic life insurance and short-term & long-term disability insurance Paid holidays, sick leave, and personal leave

Job DescriptionJob DescriptionLone Star is a manufacturer and service company for many low-pressure compressor technologies with operations around the world. Simply put, we expect the best in everything we do and hold each other accountable.Lone Star is seeking an intermediate level project engineer with 4-7 years of experience. This Project Engineer is in charge of leading projects through the production shop. They collaborate with different disciplines within the engineering group to ensure that product packages work together seamlessly. They provide technical expertise on all equipment and products, create bills of materials, specifications, procedures, and support the applications and sales departments. They work together with Project Management to ensure projects are complete, correct, follow Lone Star standards, and meet the customer's requirements and deadlines. $95kExperienced, 8+ years $90k+ Technical knowledge regarding the following:Mechanical Engineering/ Mechanical Engineering Technology Degree or direct relevant Project Engineering experienceProduct Data Management and Revision ControlSolidworks and AutoCAD4+ years of CAD Experience, 3D modeling, 2D draftingMicrosoft Office Suite- Outlook, Excel, Powerpoint, One Drive, Business Central, ShareDrivePDF Editor SoftwareExperience leading Root Cause Analysis and creating Non-conformance reports High Level of mechanical aptitude and a general understanding of electrical knowledge Ability to understand technical drawings and written specifications Must be an effective planner and organizer capable of making quick decisions when necessary Must have good oral and written communication skills Working knowledge of Microsoft systems and software Compressor or Blower experience or other engineered to order products experience is preferred Familiarity with complex machinery with control systems or rotating equipment is preferredThe following expertise is preferred: Product engineering a plus Experience working in a production shop is a plusBenefits:401(k) matchDental insuranceFlexible spending accountEmployer pays 100% employee health insurance and advantageous family medical coverageHealth savings accountPaid time offProfessional development assistanceReferral programRetirement planTuition reimbursementVision insuranceSchedule:Full-TimeMay need to work outside of normal business hours as needed. SummaryJob DescriptionThe Sales Closer position is primarily responsible for closing direct deals quoted, maintaining prospect relationships, and increasing revenue and profit by achieving high closure ratios. This position serves as the primary contact for direct clients and is responsible for client satisfaction through the sales process. This position is expected to consistently provide excellent customer service and leadership to direct accounts.Essential Duties And ResponsibilitiesIncluding the following. Other duties may be assigned.Clearly understand and follow the Kundel Sales Process. Introduce the client/prospect to Kundel and explain the sales process. Explain the order tracking system to prospect. Understand the group effort sales process and your role in the process. Maximize GPM for Kundel. Follow priorities set from Sales Process Manager. Be proficient in CRM, Smartsheet, and necessary items through the sales process. Successfully communicate Kundel’s Value Proposition to prospects. Develop list of prospect objections and script the answers for future. Align the Kundel solution to the customer’s business needs, challenges, and technical requirements. Maintain an accurate and up to date sales pipeline. Document closure ratio and the reasons why won and lost. Notify team when winning or losing trends become apparent. Past Customer Follow Up – Sales Process Manager will provide list existing accounts based on past revenue and quantity of touch points per year A, B, and C customers. Strong interpersonal and communication skills. Collect Signed Quote, Drawings, Purchase Order, and Required Payment and give to Sales Manager. Update Sales Process Manager on anything that will affect the closing process or customer satisfaction. Compensation And BenefitsThe hourly rate for this position is $17/hr. Plus Commission. With commission, a successful salesperson will be expected to close sales resulting in earning potential of approximately $70,000 the first year based upon ability. Kundel offers group medical, dental and vision benefits, as well as life insurance; 401k program with company match (up to 2%), a paid time off package, Sam's Club Membership and more. Kundel also has a fully equipped gym onsite available to all full-time employees.Kundel Industries participates in E-Verify and will provide the federal government with your Form I-9 information to confirm that you are authorized to work in the U.S.Company DescriptionKundel Industries is a family owned manufacturer of production safety equipment and services that has been in business since 1987. We are respected in the industry and have huge growth potential. We operate our business with an emphasis on Christian principles, looking out for the well-being of our employees, customers and community. We offer our employees the ability to participate in being inventive problem solvers, where they are able to incorporate their talents and offer meaningful contributions by using their creative problem solving abilities.Kundel Industries is a family owned manufacturer of production safety equipment and services that has been in business since 1987. We are respected in the industry and have huge growth potential. We operate our business with an emphasis on Christian principles, looking out for the well-being of our employees, customers and community. We offer our employees the ability to participate in being inventive problem solvers, where they are able to incorporate their talents and offer meaningful contributions by using their creative problem solving abilities.

Job DescriptionPay Range: $25 - $30/hr. depending on experience.Darwin’s Natural Pet Products is seeking an Accounting Specialist to join our Finance department. The Accounting Specialist will perform accounting functions around month end close, accounts payable and assist the accounting department with daily tasks as needed. If you are someone that enjoys a variety of responsibilities to fill your day, then this Accounting Specialist position is for you.Darwin’s Natural Pet Products makes high quality, premium raw dog and cat food and delivers it directly to pet owners around the U.S. Our growing business started 17 years ago and is a combination of both manufacturing and direct-to-consumer retailing with a strong online subscription focus. This position will be in-person at our Tukwila, WA headquarters but has the potential for a hybrid work schedule for the right person.Darwin’s offers full-time employees a comprehensive benefit package including:Comprehensive Medical, Dental, and Vision Insurance5% Company contribution to 401(k) Retirement Savings Plan (no employee contribution required)Free Life and Long-term disability insurance, Employee Assistance Program6 paid holidays (including 2 flex days)10 days PTO annually60lbs of free premium pet food monthly ($450 value). Free on-site snacksPet-friendly officeEssential Duties and Responsibilities: Support the day-to-day management of accounting department. Obtain and maintain a thorough understanding of the financial reporting and general ledger structure. Support accounts payable function by preparing and entering invoices into accounting software and other programs, setting up new vendors, running reports and troubleshooting invoice discrepancies. Assist with design, testing and integration of accounting system implementations. Document existing processes and providing recommendations to improve them. Preparing journal entries, analyses, and account reconciliations and assisting with monthly close processes. Perform daily accounting operations to assure the accurate and timely preparation of financial statements and reporting, tax returns, and budgets. Assist with expense reports and credit card administration, including reconciliation and review tasks. Assist with audit requests and tax schedules as needed. Serve as department back-up for various functions. Ad hoc duties and project support in accounting and finance as assigned. Desired Qualifications:A bachelor’s degree in Accounting or related field or equivalent experience. A minimum 3 years of industry experience, 2-3 years manufacturing accounting & sales tax experience preferred. Strong understanding of accounting concepts and financial statements. Ability to work on weekends and evenings as needed to meet applicable deadlines. Tech-savvy in MS Office Suite and able to learn new systems quickly, intermediate/advanced level in Excel, including proficiency with lookups and pivot tables a plus. Hands on experience with core ERP software a plus. Strong organizational skills and attention to detail. Demonstrated problem solving and process improvement skills. Ability to work well as part of a small team. Ability to set priorities and goals and follow through on multiple tasks simultaneously. Passion for ensuring healthy pet lifestyles – with the ability to understand and empathize with pet feeding issues – is a plus. FLSA Status: Full-time, Non-Exempt

Job DescriptionWe are seeking an Executive Assistant to join our team! You will provide high-level administrative support for an Executive at our company.Responsibilities:Handle administrative needs of Executive and other staff membersAccountingMonthly InvoicingMonthly ReconciliationsUse of bookkeeping databases, spreadsheets and softwarePosting financial transactions using appropriate computer softwareEntering debits and credits into software applications and databases accuratelyProducing a variety of reports including income statements and balance sheetsChecking for accuracy in reports, figures and postingsReconciling and reporting any discrepancies found in the recordsRedirecting calls / visitorsMaintain and order suppliesQualifications:Previous experience as an executive secretary, administrative assistant, or in other related fieldsProven accounting experience with QuickBooks OnlineFamiliarity with bookkeeping and basic accounting proceduresCompetency in MS Office, databases and accounting softwareHands-on experience with spreadsheets and financial reportsAccuracy and attention to detailAptitude for numbersAbility to perform electronic filing and record keepingWell organized

At Otelier, we put data and efficiency at the heart of hotel operations so hoteliers can return to hospitality. As the hospitality software behind every great host, we provide the tools to automate back-office tasks, streamline budgeting and forecasting, and offer crystal-clear insights into property or portfolio performance. Embrace the opportunity to be part of a transformative journey with Otelier, where we harness data to optimize operations, facilitate decision-making, and automate the mundane. This is not just a career—it is a chance to shape the future of hospitality, making data work for the industry, not the other way around.As an Account Executive, you will be pivotal to our company’s current and future success. You will be a key member of our fast-growing and high-performing sales team and critical in building personal relationships and making our prospective customers successful. Specifically, you will leverage your past sales experience to partner with potential clients to develop an interest in Otelier’s suite of software products. On a day-to-day basis, you will be responsible for conducting the full sales cycle, both prospecting and engaging with prospects and educating them about the benefits of product offerings within Otelier’s SMB segment. You will become an expert in hospitality trends and best practices and take these findings to your prospective customers. Responsibilities:• Identify potential clients through research, networking and other prospecting techniques.• Manage and track a large pipeline of leads within our CRM.• Qualify potential clients and determine their fit within the Otelier product suite.• Invest in acquiring deep industry knowledge within the hotel and hospitality industry to understand our client’s needs, challenges, and processes.• Engage with prospective clients and deliver compelling proposals & demos that align with their unique needs.• Collaborate cross-functionally to develop proposals and contracts.• Provide accurate and timely reports related to targets and sales goals.• Act as a trusted resource and advisor to clients throughout the sales journey.• Establish strategic C-level relationships across our industry.• Work both independently and collaboratively as part of the larger Revenue team to achieve sales targets and revenue goals.Requirements:• 2+ years of proven sales experience in a B2B SaaS environment• Experience in hospitality highly preferred.• Ability to run a full sales lifecycle; start to finish, within the commercial segment.• Adept at identifying and utilizing internal resources (Sales Development, Sales Engineers, etc.) to build brand awareness, assist in sales cycles, and close deals.• Proven ability to make strong connections and overcome rejection to achieve results• Exceptional interpersonal and communication skills• Preference to candidates in Georgia.

full description: Job DescriptionEagle Harbor, LLC, a subsidiary of Three Saints Bay, LLC and a Federal Government Contract industry leader, is seeking an experienced SME Sr. Acquisition Analyst to join our team & assist with support in all aspects of acquisition and systems lifecycle program management to include planning, budgeting, organizing, executing, controlling, and reporting necessary to execute the mission while maintaining program documentation in Washington, DC.Responsibilities:Assist with managing, organizing, tracking, and reporting on the program and portfolio of projects in an integrated manner in accordance with acquisition program polices, directives, and guidance. Prepare monthly reports, management work plan, contract summary report, and contract closeout reports. Support in the development, review, and maintenance of acquisition program documents for designated programs. Development and delivery of various report and documents such as: Strategic Plans, Mission Need Statements, Operational Requirements Documents, Capability Development Plans, Acquisition Plans, Acquisition Program Baselines, Integrated Logistics Support Plans, Concept of Operations, Analysis of Alternatives, Lifecycle Cost Estimates, Test and Evaluation Master Plans, Risk Management Plans, Program Risk Matrix, and other acquisition documents. Assist in preparation and annual maintenance / Business Case and entry and review of program information in the agency system and other program reporting database updates. Maintaining and updating project and program schedules. Assist designated project managers in creating and updating project schedules and work breakdown structures and providing monthly updates to the program manager and project managers in various views and formats for briefings or deliverables required by internal and external stakeholders. Developing performance metrics for projects and assistance in reporting. Documenting the scope of individual projects. Developing standard reporting templates. Manage teams of contract support personnel at multiple locations. Maintain and manage the client interface at the senior levels of the client organization. Meet with customer and contractor personnel to formulate and review task plans and deliverable items. Ensure conformance with program task schedules and costs. Organize and delegate responsibilities to subordinates. Establish and maintain technical and financial reports to show progress of projects to management and customers. Requirements:10+ years of government acquisition program management position and a general knowledge of Federal contract requirements. Proven experience as a Program Manager or other managerial position in creating and maintaining projects and working with stakeholders and complex organizations. Thorough understanding of project/program management techniques and methods for Information Technology used throughout DHS and similar agencies. Knowledge of the business and financial impacts of alternative procurement approaches. Knowledge of business, industrial practices, market trends and conditions, and relationships among development, testing, product, and marketing costs in order to determine their effects on complex multi-year programs involving business environments. Ability to work in a dynamic work environment and ability to coordinate and perform multiple assignments. Excellent knowledge of performance evaluation and change management principles. Must possess analytical, assertive, creative, and effective problem-solving skills. Must possess excellent communication skills - both written and verbal. Maintain a working knowledge of the Department of Homeland Security Acquisition Framework and/or Systems Engineering Lifecycle processes. Position located: Washington, DCApply at: https://phg.tbe.taleo.net/phg01/ats/careers/v2/viewRequisition?org=GATEWAYVENT&cws=69&rid=3769VEVRAA Federal ContractorThree Saints Bay, LLC and its subsidiaries offer a diverse, team-oriented working environment and the opportunity to work with exceptional dedicated industry professionals. We offer our employees a comprehensive benefits package and the opportunity to take part in exciting projects with government and commercial clients, both domestic and international.We are an EEO/AA employer. We invite resumes from all interested parties without regard to race, color, religion, creed, gender, national origin, age, genetic information, marital or veteran status, disability, or any other category protected by federal, state, or local law.

Company:Cogent Communications is a multinational, Tier 1 facilities-based ISP, consistently ranked as one of the top five networks in the world and is publicly traded on the NASDAQ Stock Market under the ticker symbol CCOI. Cogent specializes in providing businesses with high speed Internet access and Ethernet transport services. Cogent's facilities-based, all-optical IP network backbone provides IP services in over 180 markets globally. Since its inception, Cogent has unleashed the benefits of IP technology, building one of the largest and highest capacity IP networks in the world. This network enables Cogent to offer large bandwidth connections at highly competitive prices. Cogent also offers superior customer support by virtue of its end-to-end control of service delivery and network monitoring. A generous base salary, structured tenure pay increases and an uncapped commissions plan offers you an unlimited earnings potential. A full benefits package takes effect within 30 days of employment. Matching 401k and stock options are also included.Responsibilities: Hunting to Identify new business opportunities within National Sales Territory focused on the Mid Market and non-named National Account target market segments ( up to 500 – 999 employees)  Through direct calling, email and other contact efforts you will identify, qualify, and generate these new business opportunities by working directly with Key Decision Makers  Compliment prospecting and selling efforts through field work such as building walks, lobby events, property management relationships, and customer face to face meetings  Leverage consultative and relationship building selling techniques you will identify current and future connectivity solutions  Help Cogent customers and prospects by positioning our services for new business  Achieve monthly revenue goals by selling into the nation's largest commercial and retail buildings; office parks and professional campuses Qualifications: 2-5 years of solid, sales experience, preferably B2B and in the technology field  Previous sales experience ( recent experience strongly preferred) with a track record of success is required  You must be able to demonstrate your ability to identify, qualify and generate new business through extensive prospecting and research  Strong oral and written communication is required  Ability to work in a fast paced, team environment with revenue deadlines  Working knowledge of computer applications such as Microsoft Office and a CRM are a plus  A college degree is preferred but not required  If this sounds like you apply today! Work Environment: To best support your success, this is an in-office position five days a week, allowing for focused mentorship, training and personal coaching. COVID-19 Policy: Cogent has adopted a mandatory vaccination and booster policy which requires all U.S. employees to be fully vaccinated ( including booster shots when eligible) against COVID-19. Prior to beginning employment, new employees must provide proof of vaccination or apply for and receive an accommodation to be exempt from the policy. By submitting an application or resume for this position, I understand that is an in-office position and agree to abide Cogent’s mandatory vaccination policy.“Cogent’s competitive advantage lies in our people...their spirit, their energy and their commitment.”Dave Schaeffer, Founder & CEOCogent Communications is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Company  :Cogent Communications is a multinational, Tier 1 facilities-based ISP, consistently ranked as one of the top five networks in the world and is publicly traded on the NASDAQ Stock Market under the ticker symbol CCOI. Cogent specializes in providing businesses with high speed Internet access and Ethernet transport services. Cogent's facilities-based, all-optical IP network backbone provides IP services in over 206 markets globally. Since its inception, Cogent has unleashed the benefits of IP technology, building one of the largest and highest capacity IP networks in the world. This network enables Cogent to offer large bandwidth connections at highly competitive prices. Cogent also offers superior customer support by virtue of its end-to-end control of service delivery and network monitoring. A generous base salary, structured tenure pay increases and an uncapped commissions plan offers you an unlimited earnings potential. A full benefits package takes effect within 30 days of employment. Matching 401k and stock options are also included. Responsibilities  : Hunting to identify new business opportunities within a global sales territory and target market segments of IP Transit, Content creators/hosters, Carriers/wholesalers and Netcentric companies.  Through direct calling, email and contact efforts you will identify, qualify, and generate these new business opportunities by working directly with Key Decision Makers.  Compliment prospecting and selling efforts through onsite customer meetings as needed.  Use consultative and relationship building selling techniques to identify current and future connectivity solutions.  Help Cogent customers and prospects by positioning our services for new business by leveraging the global network footprint that includes commercial and retail buildings, carrier neutral hotels, data centers and colocation facilities.  Qualifications  : 3-8+ years of solid, B2B sales experience in a telecom arena with collocation, wholesale experience and data transit and transport.  Proven experience with a track record of success in a direct hunting, B2B sales role and quota achievement.  Demonstrated ability to identify, qualify and generate new business through extensive prospecting and research.  Strong oral and written communication skills are a must.  Ability to work in a fast paced, team environment with revenue deadlines.  Working knowledge of computer applications such as Microsoft Office and a CRM are a plus.  A college degree is preferred but not required.  If this sounds like you apply today!  Compensation: Pay Range: $40,000 - $90,000Commission: UnlimitedAdditional Compensation Potential: National Account Managers have an achievable upside opportunity to grow base pay by up to $25,000 - $35,000 based on performance. Our recruiting team will tell you how!Work Environment: To best support your success, this is an in-office position five days a week, allowing for focused mentorship, training and personal coaching. COVID-19 Policy: Cogent has adopted a mandatory vaccination and booster policy which requires all U.S. employees to be fully vaccinated ( including booster shots when eligible) against COVID-19. Prior to beginning employment, new employees must provide proof of vaccination or apply for and receive an accommodation to be exempt from the policy. By submitting an application or resume for this position, I understand that is an in-office position and agree to abide Cogent’s mandatory vaccination policy.“Cogent’s competitive advantage lies in our people...their spirit, their energy and their commitment.”Dave Schaeffer, Founder & CEOCogent Communications is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Company:Cogent Communications is a multinational, Tier 1 facilities-based ISP, consistently ranked as one of the top five networks in the world, and is publicly traded on the NASDAQ Stock Market under the ticker symbol CCOI. Cogent specializes in providing businesses with high-speed Internet access and Ethernet transport services. Cogent's facilities-based, all-optical IP network backbone provides IP services in over 180 markets globally. Since its inception, Cogent has unleashed the benefits of IP technology, building one of the largest and highest-capacity IP networks in the world. This network enables Cogent to offer large bandwidth connections at highly competitive prices. Cogent also offers superior customer support by virtue of its end-to-end control of service delivery and network monitoring. A generous base salary, structured tenure pay increases, and an uncapped commissions plan offer you an unlimited earnings potential. A full benefits package takes effect within 30 days of employment. Matching 401k and stock options are also included. Cogent offers a full benefits package including; Health, Dental, Vision, Paid Time Off ( PTO), Short and Long Term Disability, Life Insurance, Holidays, Parental Leave, 401 ( k) plan with employer match, stock options, and an Employee Assistance Program. Most benefits take effect within 30 days of employment, and some require a waiting period.Compensation:Pay Range: $40,000 - $80,000Commission: UnlimitedAdditional Compensation Potential: National Account Managers have an achievable upside opportunity to grow base pay by up to $25,000 - $35,000 based on performance. Our recruiting team will tell you how!Responsibilities: Hunting to Identify new business opportunities within National Sales Territory focused on the Mid Market and non-named National Account target market segments ( up to 500 – 999 employees)  Through direct calling, email and other contact efforts you will identify, qualify, and generate these new business opportunities by working directly with Key Decision Makers  Compliment prospecting and selling efforts through field work such as building walks, lobby events, property management relationships, and customer face to face meetings  Leverage consultative and relationship building selling techniques you will identify current and future connectivity solutions  Help Cogent customers and prospects by positioning our services for new business  Achieve monthly revenue goals by selling into the nation's largest commercial and retail buildings; office parks and professional campuses Qualifications: 2-5 years of solid, sales experience, preferably B2B and in the technology field  Previous sales experience ( recent experience strongly preferred) with a track record of success is required  You must be able to demonstrate your ability to identify, qualify and generate new business through extensive prospecting and research  Strong oral and written communication is required  Ability to work in a fast paced, team environment with revenue deadlines  Working knowledge of computer applications such as Microsoft Office and a CRM are a plus  A college degree is preferred but not required  If this sounds like you apply today! Work Environment: To best support your success, this is an in-office position five days a week, allowing for focused mentorship, training and personal coaching.
